I am very focused! He threatened you! His heart was not the heart of a pilgrim, but the heart of a hunter.<page>Welcome to Lantern, powerful traveler! This is a sacred place, but it is a ghost.<page>Please give me a brief warning before you leave.<page>Our kingdom is surrounded by a curse, the streets become wild and dangerous, and some people try to climb the top of the castle, but no one talks about what they see.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>我不是朝圣者，我是朝圣者，我别无选择，只能来到你们的国家。<hpage>我被强行拖进他的王国，被一只戴着面纱的奇怪昆虫抓住。<page>我的天啊！多么好奇啊！城堡的昆虫在地上，他们需要信仰，可能是更伟大的东西的奴隶。<hpage>如果这些隐藏的错误让我走了这么远，找出原因。<page>我的天啊！我非常专注！他威胁你！他的心不是朝圣者的心，而是猎人的心。<page>欢迎来到灯笼，强大的旅行者！这是一个神圣的地方，但它是一个鬼魂。<page>离开前请给我一个简短的警告。<page>我们的王国被诅咒包围，街道变得狂野而危险，有些人试图爬上城堡的顶部，但没有人谈论他们所看到的。

original_en_text: So you’re another pilgrim then? Scuttled out of the darkness to climb the great path and bow at its gilded peak?
original_zh_text: 这么说你也是个朝圣者？从黑暗里钻出来就为攀那条路，去镀金尖顶上叩拜？
translated_text: Are you a pilgrim? Digging in the dark, taking to the streets, leaning against a golden mountain?
secondary_translated_text: 你是朝圣者吗？在黑暗中挖掘，走上街头，倚着金山？

original_en_text: Well, look at that! You’ve gone and donated all those shell shards, just like I wished for! I can scarcely believe it!<page>Those shards are valuable, alright. Brilliant for crafting and fixing, very versatile.<page>More than that, though... it was a warm thing you did, the sort of kindness you don’t see much in this weary place.<hpage>Was this kindness? I must take care to learn of this land and claim what advantage I can from it. Answering requests like yours can often fit those ends.<page>Oh, it’s like that, is it? Well, even still, the help’s well appreciated, miss. Best of luck in your travels, and may every wish of yours be granted!
original_zh_text: 哎呀呀！你居然真捐了这么多甲壳碎片！跟我许的愿一模一样！简直不敢相信！<page>这些碎片用处可不少，又能造东西又能修修补补。<page>不过更重要的是……你做了件暖心事，这破地方可少见这种善举。<hpage>善意？我需要审慎了解这里，好为自己谋取利益。回应你的祈愿只是手段。<page>哦，原来如此？但帮忙总归是好的，小姐。祝旅途顺利，愿你所有愿望都能实现！
translated_text: I have all the bullets and I want you to see this! This is unbelievable!<page>They are ideal for production and maintenance and can be used in a variety of applications.<page>However, this is not the only thing. What you are doing is a warm and wonderful thing that is hard to find in this tired place.<hpage>Honesty? We must seriously understand this land and benefit from it.<page>"Yes, yes, yes. "Thank you for your help, girl. Have a pleasant journey and all your wishes will come true!
secondary_translated_text: 我有所有的子弹，我想让你看看这个！这太不可思议了！<page>它们非常适合生产和维护，可用于各种应用。<page>然而，这并不是唯一的事情。你正在做的事情是一件温暖而美妙的事情，在这个疲惫的地方很难找到。<hpage>诚实？我们必须认真了解这片土地并从中受益。<page>“是的，是的，是的。“谢谢你的帮助，女孩。祝您旅途愉快，您所有的愿望都会实现！

original_en_text: Oh, oh dear... what fearful events are sent to test we poor pilgrims! How could it be that our path to paradise is infested with such beasts?<page>To brave such a world... oh my. I’ll need more rosaries, that’s for certain. Please traveller, won’t you trade with me?
original_zh_text: 噢，圣堡啊……为何设置这等可怖灾厄考验可怜的朝圣者！通往乐土之路怎么会遍布恶兽？<page>要继续朝圣之路……唉，需要更多念珠。旅者，愿意交易吗？
translated_text: "Yes, dear, life as a poor pilgrim would be terrible."<page>Be brave in front of the world-oh, I definitely need more rosary books. Now you are a traveler. Aren't you going to do business with me? "
secondary_translated_text: “是的，亲爱的，贫穷朝圣者的生活会很可怕。"<page>在世界面前勇敢一点--哦，我肯定需要更多的念珠书。现在你是一名旅行者。你不和我做生意吗？"

original_en_text: You are my wish granter, yes? My wish! I need fruits of the world, three little darlings. I need them, so I wish!<page>You made the promise. A binding stronger than sin. Bring me the three Mossberries. Precious fruit! Grant my wish, and then the work begins!
original_zh_text: 你实现我的祈愿，对吧？我的祈愿！我要这世间的三枚果实，小宝贝果实。我需要，所以祈愿！<page>你应诺祈愿，比罪孽更牢固的契约。带给我三颗苔莓。珍果！应我祈愿，大业方启！
translated_text: You granted my wish, didn't you? My wish! It takes three children to reap the fruits of the world.<page>I assure you that this is a covenant stronger than sin. Give me three muses, a precious fruit. Your wish has come true and the work has begun!
secondary_translated_text: 你实现了我的愿望，不是吗？我的愿望！需要三个孩子才能收获世界的果实。<page>我向你保证，这是一个比罪更强大的约。给我三个缪斯女神，一颗珍贵的果实。您的愿望实现了，工作已经开始！

original_en_text: I’ve a long way to go, and much more to see. For now though, let’s just rest a little while, eh?
original_zh_text: 前面还有不少路要走，也有不少新鲜事物等着发现。但现在，不如一起休息一会吧。
translated_text: We still have a long way to go and a lot to see, but let's rest.
secondary_translated_text: 我们还有很长的路要走，还有很多东西要看，但让我们休息吧。

original_en_text: Times are hard, so fresh supplies are always welcome! Bugs arrive here with nothin’ and often leave without much more.
original_zh_text: 时局艰难，物资紧缺！虫子们来时两手空空，走时也带不走啥。
translated_text: The weather is tough, but freshness is always welcome. This error has nothing, and when it disappears, there is nothing.
secondary_translated_text: 天气恶劣，但新鲜感总是受欢迎的。这个错误什么也没有，当它消失时，什么也没有。

original_en_text: Well now! Seems I’ve traded you the last of my supplies, so I’ve got no more excuses to linger down here.<page>I’ll soon be making my way up to the great Citadel. As holy as I am with rosaries, I’m sure my path will not be an arduous one...
original_zh_text: 哎呀！最后的存货都换予你了，这下没借口留下啦。<page>很快要上圣堡了。揣着这么多念珠，肯定能一路顺畅……
translated_text: I'm okay, I'm okay! Okay, okay! Okay! There are no excuses here, as if you are exchanging for the last supply.<page>Although I am a rosary saint, I believe my journey will not be difficult.
secondary_translated_text: 我没事，我没事！好吧，好吧！好的！这里没有任何借口，就好像你在交换最后的供应一样。<page>虽然我是念珠圣人，但我相信我的旅程不会很困难。

original_en_text: Bring more Mossberries here. Mmm. Yes, we will trade. Precious rosaries for fresh berries! Seek them wherever you see the green moss grow!
original_zh_text: 带更多苔莓来。嗯。用念珠换鲜果！青苔生长处都有踪迹！
translated_text: Please give me a piece of mousse. All right, let's make a deal. Beautiful roses and fresh berries! Even if you see green flies growing, give it a try.
secondary_translated_text: 请给我一块慕斯。好吧，我们做个交易。美丽的玫瑰和新鲜的浆果！即使您看到绿蝇生长，也要尝试一下。

original_en_text: You bear your blade well, hunter, and you’ve skill, no doubt, so I don’t mean any unkindness when I say you still seem a little frail.<hpage>I was a long time spent captive, bound by seals strange to me. My strength is diminished, but recoverable.<hpage>By the time I reach that Citadel, I’ll be ready to face what waits.
original_zh_text: 你执刃的姿态不错，猎手，本领想必了得。不过恕我直言，你看上去仍有些虚弱。<hpage>我遭囚禁多日，又被陌生封印束缚。气力虽然衰微，但尚可恢复。<hpage>等我抵达圣堡之时，自然会做好准备。
translated_text: Hunter, you are very good at swordsmanship. Of course you have skills. It's useless to appear weak.<hpage>For a long time, I was trapped in a strange trap and lost my strength, but I managed to recover.<hpage>When I arrived at the castle, I was ready for what was to come.
secondary_translated_text: 猎人，你的剑术很好。你当然有技能。表现得软弱是没有用的。<hpage>很长一段时间，我被困在一个奇怪的陷阱里，失去了力量，但我设法恢复了过来。<hpage>当我到达城堡时，我已经为即将发生的事情做好了准备。

original_en_text: Oh! Hunter, aren’t you in a sorry state? You’re all bound up, looking worse than when we first met!<hpage>My shell has become host to a cruel parasite. Though my natural strength keeps it from consuming me entirely, I’m much weakened by its presence.<page>Well, this just won’t do! Pharloom’s already in the snare of one fell curse, we can’t have another vying to leech what life remains.<page>Best you head quick over to that town of bells, at the core of our kingdom. I’ve an uncle hidden about there, an old hermit, and a horrid curmudgeon.<page>That hermit’s a hard one to befriend, but he holds some knowledge about this kingdom’s maladies. If anyone’s able to point you to a cure, it’ll be him.
original_zh_text: 哦！猎手，看你这副惨状。全身像被缠住，比初见时更狼狈了。<hpage>我受到险恶寄生体的侵蚀。虽凭借本源之力阻止了吞噬，仍被大幅削弱。<page>这怎么行！纺络已然陷于一道诅咒，怎能再让另一道来争夺残存的生机。<page>快去王国腹地的钟心镇，我在那有个隐居的叔父，就是脾气臭得很。<page>与他结交并不容易，但他了解不少病症。要说有谁能指点医治方法，非他莫属。
translated_text: Oh, my God! "Are you happy, Hunter? You're under attack, you look worse than when we met!<hpage>The power I was born with did not completely consume me.<page>It doesn't work! "Pharaoh was trapped under the curse of corruption and for the rest of his life he was unable to compete with others.<page>They fled to Bell, in the heart of our kingdom, where I had a hidden uncle, an old man, rude and scary.<page>The hermit had difficulty making friends, but he understood the evil of the kingdom. If anyone can tell you what treatment is, it is you.
secondary_translated_text: 我的天啊！“你高兴吗，亨特？你受到攻击了，你看起来比我们见面时更糟糕！<hpage>我与生俱来的力量并没有完全消耗我。<page>它不工作！“法老被困在腐败的诅咒之下，一生都无法与他人竞争。<page>他们逃到了我们王国中心的贝尔，在那里我有一个隐藏的叔叔，一个老人，粗鲁而可怕。<page>隐士很难结交朋友，但他了解王国的邪恶。如果有人能告诉你什么是治疗，那就是你。

original_en_text: Mmm, the precious fruit! And... oh! Such fruit! Perfectly ripe! Perfectly fragrant! Perfectly round! Take what you have earned, much of much rosaries!
original_zh_text: 嗯，珍果！啊……极品！熟透！芬芳！浑圆！拿好，念珠多多，你当之无愧！
translated_text: Precious fruits and... Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! This fruit! They are completely ready! Here, smell! Make the most of the money you earn!
secondary_translated_text: 珍贵的水果和.哦！哦！哦！哦！这个水果！他们完全准备好了！这里，闻闻！充分利用你赚的钱！

original_en_text: O-oh! Traveller! Won’t you stop and make trade with an old pilgrim? Surely something here will aid you in your great journey!
original_zh_text: 噢！旅者！来与我做笔交易？总有物件能在旅途中助你一臂之力！
translated_text: Oh, my God! Traveler! Why not stop making treaties with ancient pilgrims? Staying here will definitely be useful for your trip!
secondary_translated_text: 我的天啊！旅行者！为什么不停止与古代朝圣者签订条约呢？住在这里一定会对您的旅行有用！

original_en_text: You keep the fruit for yourself? For greed? Strange choice! It will only weigh you down...
original_zh_text: 私藏果实？贪婪？奇怪选择！徒增负担……
translated_text: Do you want some fruit? Is it because of greed? What a strange choice! This will make you feel heavy.
secondary_translated_text: 你想要一些水果吗？是因为贪婪吗？多么奇怪的选择啊！这会让你感到沉重。

original_en_text: Don’t go thinkin’ fear’s keepin’ me from my own pilgrimage! S’just there’s a lotta work still to do here and few bugs able to do it.
original_zh_text: 别以为我是怕了才不去朝圣！实在是这里活儿多帮手少。
translated_text: Please do not think that fear will hinder my pilgrimage. "There are many things you can do and very few things you can do.
secondary_translated_text: 请不要认为恐惧会阻碍我的朝圣之旅。“你能做的事情很多，但你能做的事情却很少。

original_en_text: Sing for our brother, who has died a devout death! All his pains and torments left behind, like the dust shrugged from a traveller’s shawl.
original_zh_text: 为兄弟而歌，他死得虔诚！所有苦痛皆抛却，如旅者抖落披肩尘埃。
translated_text: All his sufferings and trials were behind him, like dust on a traveler's clothes.
secondary_translated_text: 他所有的痛苦和考验都已过去，就像旅行者衣服上的灰尘一样。

original_en_text: Promised, then. A binding stronger than sin. Bring me the three Mossberries. Precious fruit! Grant my wish, and then the work begins!
original_zh_text: 祈愿已承，比罪孽更牢固的契约。带给我三颗苔莓。珍果！应我祈愿，大业方启！
translated_text: This is a stronger bond than sin. Give me three muses! What a precious fruit! Your wish has come true and the work has begun!
secondary_translated_text: 这是一种比罪恶更强大的纽带。给我三个缪斯！多么珍贵的水果啊！您的愿望实现了，工作已经开始！

original_en_text: Mm. Mmm! Who is it? An intruder! Terrible! To interrupt a humble druid as they work!<hpage>I meant no intrusion, druid. The sound of your laughter drew me to investigate.<hpage>This settlement is built around an old structure of the Weavers. Do you know of them? Do they inhabit this land still?<page>Mm? What settlement? What Weavers?! You speak nonsense!
original_zh_text: 嗯。嗯嗯！谁在那儿？入侵者！可恶！竟敢打扰德鲁伊修行！<hpage>无心冒犯，德鲁伊。你的笑声引我前来探查。<hpage>这聚落环绕古织者遗迹而建。你可知晓他们？是否仍居于此？<page>嗯？什么聚落？什么织者？！胡言乱语！
translated_text: Oh, my God! Yes, yes! "Who are you? Invasion!!! The scary thing is that the humble robot's work has stopped!<hpage>The robot didn't want to interfere with his laughter and asked me to investigate.<hpage>The colony was built around the old buildings of the Tokachov family. Do you understand? Are they still alive on earth?<page>What is this? What are you doing? Conciliation? What kind of sewing machine? You are ridiculous!“
secondary_translated_text: 我的天啊！对，对！“你是谁？入侵！可怕的是，不起眼的机器人的工作已经停止了！<hpage>机器人不想干扰他的笑声，并要求我调查一下。<hpage>该殖民地是围绕托加乔夫家族的老建筑而建的。你明白了吗？他们还活着在地球上吗？<page>这是什么？你在干什么？和解？什么样的缝纫机？你太荒谬了！“

original_en_text: <hpage>Madam, I return seeking power to aid the construction of a trap, at request of your sibling residing atop the Citadel.<page>Aye, hunter. So you managed to rouse the old fool. I’ve known it coming, felt it, and glad I am! <page>Rest’a my family spent far too long huddled and glum... or dead! Not me! I’d always been thinkin’ it a waste to just take what’s coming, when her up top wakes.<page>Better to fight for freedom or go out in a blaze, oh ho!
original_zh_text: <hpage>女士，我应你同胞之请归来，寻求助力建造陷阱——他正蛰伏圣堡之中。<page>啊，猎手。你果然说动了那老顽固。我早有预感，真是欣慰！<page>家族里其他虫要么缩着发愁……要么死了！我不一样！早就觉得坐等顶上那位苏醒是浪费生命。<page>宁可死也要争取自由，嚯嚯！
translated_text: <hpage>At the request of my brothers and sisters who live on top of the castle, I again asked for their help in building an electronic trap.<page>I woke up like a fool, I knew what was happening, and I was happy.<page>My family was together for a long time and she was unhappy. No, this is me! I don't think it's useful to accept what happens when you wake up.<page>Are you fighting for freedom, or are you fighting for freedom?
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>应住在城堡顶上的兄弟姐妹的要求，我再次请求他们帮助建造电子陷阱。<page>我像个傻瓜一样醒来，我知道发生了什么，我很高兴。<page>我们一家人在一起很长时间了，她很不高兴。不，这是我！我不认为接受醒来后发生的事有什么用。<page>你是为自由而战，还是为自由而战？

original_en_text: Mmm, the precious fruit! Ah... but! This one is not so fresh. Rotten! Stench of death! A meagre amount of rosaries for you. As much as you deserve!
original_zh_text: 嗯，珍果！啊……但这颗不鲜。腐坏！死气熏天！只配少少念珠！
translated_text: Great fruit, maybe! It's not fresh, dirty bastard, it stinks! This is a small place to do what you have to do!
secondary_translated_text: 水果，也许吧。这不是新鲜的，肮脏的混蛋，太臭了！这是一个做你必须做的事情的小地方！

translated_text: <hpage>The pilgrim's name is Philby.

original_en_text: Once this wishwall is up, bugs’ll be able to seek help from any able shell around. You could even try granting a couple of wishes yourself, missy!
original_zh_text: <page>等这祈愿墙立起来，大伙就能向能者求助了。小姐你说不定还能帮忙实现几个愿望呢！
translated_text: Once a wall of desire is established, insects can rely on a shell from which to seek help.
secondary_translated_text: 一旦欲望之墙建立起来，昆虫就可以依靠贝壳寻求帮助。

original_en_text: Rest here with me as long as you like. I’m not ready to leave yet, and a little company is always nice.
original_zh_text: 你想休息多久都可以。我尚未准备好启程，有个伴总是好的。
translated_text: You can relax here. "I'm not ready yet, dear friend, and that's always a good thing. "
secondary_translated_text: 您可以在这里放松身心。“我还没有准备好，亲爱的朋友，这总是一件好事。"

original_en_text: Down here, you can’t hear the cries of the pilgrims above, only the faintly ringing bells. I’ll stay and meditate a little longer, before I start my own pilgrimage...
original_zh_text: 在这儿听不见上头朝圣者的哭嚎，只有隐隐钟鸣。启程前我要多冥想会儿……
translated_text: Here, you can't hear the cries of pilgrims, only the faint sound of bells. I meditated for a moment and began my pilgrimage. "
secondary_translated_text: 在这里，你听不到朝圣者的哭声，只有微弱的钟声。我沉思了一会儿，开始了我的朝圣之旅。"

original_en_text: Farewell, brother Pilby. May your shell harden the path for others to tread.
original_zh_text: 永别了，小皮尔比。愿你的甲壳为后来者铺路。
translated_text: Goodbye, brother Philby, your body will pave the way for others.
secondary_translated_text: 再见，菲尔比兄弟，你的身体将为他人铺平道路。

translated_text: Monster! Beast! Terrible beast!

original_en_text: ...Hm. Who here knows the name of this little pilgrim?
original_zh_text: ……嗯。在场有谁记得这虫的名字？
translated_text: ...¿Does anyone know the name of this cake?
secondary_translated_text: ...¿有人知道这个蛋糕的名字吗？

original_en_text: Common stuff, shell shards, but very practical. I can use ‘em to patch almost anything up, and this camp’s always in need of some mending.
original_zh_text: 甲壳碎片虽然普通，但实用。我能拿它们修补大半东西，这营地可少不了修修补补。
translated_text: This is a common problem, it's a shell of a shell, but it's very practical. In fact, everything can be fixed, but this area must be fixed.
secondary_translated_text: 这是一个常见的问题，这是一个壳中的壳，但它非常实用。其实一切都可以修复，但这个区域必须修复。

original_en_text: And another poor pilgrim lost, eh? Just the thought of it makes me weary. Better to put my head down and work ‘til the job’s done...
original_zh_text: 又没了个朝圣者？光想想就累得慌。还是干活吧……
translated_text: I'm tired of thinking about it, so it's best to keep my head down and work hard until the end.
secondary_translated_text: 我厌倦了想这个，所以最好低着头，努力工作到最后。

original_en_text: Hm? A fellow pilgrim, are you? About to start your great journey to the holy Citadel up top?<hpage>I am no pilgrim, sir, though it seems we will be travelling a similar path.<page>Not a pilgrim? Well, it makes no difference, I suppose. We all must walk the roads, up and up, though most of us will fall long before we see the grand gates.<page>If you’re wise, you’ll stop here and rest a while before heading out into that dangerous world...
original_zh_text: 嗯？你也是朝圣者？准备启程攀登圣堡了？<hpage>我并非朝圣者，先生，但前路或许相仿。<page>不是？也罢。众生皆须行路攀爬，但大多未睹圣门便殒命。<page>你若明智，启程前应该在此休整……
translated_text: What is this? What are you doing? Are you a pilgrim? Actually? Ready to enter the Holy City?<hpage>Although I am not a pilgrim, I think we are embarking on a similar path.<page>Aren't you a pilgrim? "We all had to follow this road, but most of us fell before we saw the beautiful gate.<page>If you are smart, stop here for a rest and enter this dangerous world.
secondary_translated_text: 这是什么？你在干什么？你是朝圣者吗？实际上？准备好进入圣城了吗？<hpage>虽然我不是朝圣者，但我认为我们正在走上类似的道路。<page>你不是朝圣者吗？“我们都必须沿着这条路走，但大多数人在看到美丽的大门之前就摔倒了。<page>如果你聪明，就在这里停下来休息，进入这个危险的世界。

original_en_text: And for the parting, a gift. An amulet of we druids. Or me druid? No others, I think.<page>May it ease your sorrows, wish granter. May it cry for you when no tears are left!
original_zh_text: 临别赠礼。我们德鲁伊护符。或者，我的护符？似乎只剩我。<page>希望它能缓解你的哀伤，授愿者。眼泪干涸时，护符为你哭泣！
translated_text: Before we say goodbye, I have another gift, a robot amulet. Am I a robot? I don't think there's anyone else.<page>"You are very happy. Relieve your pain and be with you. When I have no tears, let me cry for you.
secondary_translated_text: 在我们说再见之前，我有另一个礼物，一个机器人护身符。我是机器人吗？我想没有其他人了。<page>“你很幸福。减轻你的痛苦和你在一起。当我没有眼泪的时候，让我为你哭泣。

original_en_text: Mmm! Mmm! You carry a sweet, precious smell with you. A fruit! Will you trade it for rosaries?
original_zh_text: 嗯嗯！嗯！你身上的甜美气息。鲜果！用念珠交换？
translated_text: Oh! Oh! Oh, Oh! It gives you a sweet and precious fragrance. Fruit! Why not replace Roger?
secondary_translated_text: 哦！哦！哦，哦！它给你一种甜美而珍贵的香味。水果！为什么不取代罗杰？

original_en_text: <hpage>I wonder, little pilgrim. What calls you and your fellows up to the Citadel? If the way is dangerous, why take the journey at all?<page>Strange question to be asking of a pilgrim. Our holy land calls on us. To journey up is our greatest task. Who are we to refuse?<page>Guided by faith, we climb through flaming fields, across rolling moors, and up great gilded steps. All to reach that eternal, shining Citadel.<page>Once I’m good and ready, I’ll make the climb myself...
original_zh_text: <hpage>小朝圣者，我有些好奇。是什么召唤你前往圣堡？既然道途凶险，为何仍要涉险？<page>问朝圣者这话可真怪。圣堡召唤，攀登就是我等天职。怎么能违抗？<page>凭着信仰穿越火野，踏过灰沼，登上金阶。只为抵达永恒辉煌的圣堡。<page>待准备妥当，我就会启程……
translated_text: <hpage>"Young pilgrim, what did you and your friends do to come to the castle? "If this road is dangerous, why take this road?”<page>The Holy Land is calling us. Tourism is our main activity. Who has the right to refuse?<page>Guided by faith, we climbed the fire, the spinning valley and the majestic golden staircase.<page>When you are ready, you go on your own.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>“年轻的朝圣者，你和你的朋友们来到城堡做了什么？“如果这条路很危险，为什么要走这条路呢？”<page>圣地正在召唤我们。旅游业是我们的主要活动。谁有权拒绝？<page>在信仰的指引下，我们爬上了火、旋转的山谷和雄伟的金色楼梯。<page>当你准备好后，你就自己去。

original_en_text: Mmm. Mmm! The pain... my mind aches. Why? The berries, the nasty fruits. Oh the visions!<page>You, wish promiser. Wish granter. You brought me what I needed and stayed by my side. Companion through my ordeal. I could ask for nothing more.
original_zh_text: 嗯。嗯！痛楚……心如火灼。为什么？莓果，秽果。啊，那些幻象！<page>你，应诺者，授愿者。你实现我愿，伴我受难。我再无所求。
translated_text: Oh, my God! Yes, yes! "Pain is... ... "My heart hurts, why? Belvin, boring fruit. My vision!<page>They gave me everything I needed and they were always there for me.
secondary_translated_text: 我的天啊！对，对！“痛苦是. ...“我的心很痛，为什么？贝尔文，无聊的水果。我的愿景！<page>他们为我提供了我需要的一切，而且他们总是在我身边。

original_en_text: Ahhh! Ahhh-ohhhh! The smell is right! Like the others! But very young! Oh, voice of the woods! Oh, dance of the queen! Oh... oh! Beat harder, let us hear it! Oh! Ohhhhhhhh!
original_zh_text: 啊啊！啊——噢！气味对了！就像其他！但尚幼嫩！啊，林间之声！啊，女王之舞！啊……啊！搏动吧，让我聆听！啊！啊啊啊！
translated_text: Yes, right. Oh, yes! Oh, yes! Oh, yes! Tastes better! Just like everyone else! Shit, guys! The noise of the forest! The Queen's Dance! Oh, yes! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! If you push, you will feel it. Oh, yes!
secondary_translated_text: 是的，正确的。哦，是的！哦，是的！哦，是的！味道更好！就像其他人一样！该死，伙计们！森林的噪音！女王之舞！哦，是的！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！如果你推，你就会感觉到。哦，是的！

original_en_text: Sing, brothers and sisters! Sing, and drown out this burdensome sorrow! Sing out the name of this poor pilgrim, whose journey had nary begun!
original_zh_text: 唱吧，兄弟姐妹！用歌声淹没这沉痛哀伤！为这未启程便陨落的朝圣者高歌！
translated_text: Brothers, sing! If you drink it, it will hurt you. He sang the names of the poor pilgrims who had not yet begun their journey.
secondary_translated_text: 兄弟们，唱歌！如果你喝了它，它会伤害你。他唱出了尚未开始旅程的贫穷朝圣者的名字。

original_en_text: Have you heard the talk of what waits just beyond this camp?<page>Brittle caverns of bone, the very base of Pharloom, filled with all manner of deadly creatures and jagged dangers.<page>It’s said ancient bugs once made their homes amidst it.<page>Who could believe! In such a hostile, unstable place! In all my time, I’ve never met a bug so brave.
original_zh_text: 你可曾听闻营地外的传闻？<page>骸骨脆岩构成纺络的基底，布满凶兽利齿。<page>据说古虫曾在此安家。<page>谁信啊！这种险恶之地！我这辈子没见过这么勇敢的虫。
translated_text: Have you heard what they are waiting for outside the camp?<page>A fragile bone hole in the farm floor is full of deadly creatures and dangers.<page>It is speculated that ancient insects once lived here.<page>Who can trust us? In such an unstable and unstable place, I have never encountered such a brave insect.
secondary_translated_text: 你听说他们在营地外等什么了吗？<page>农场地板上一个脆弱的骨洞里充满了致命的生物和危险。<page>据推测，古代昆虫曾经生活在这里。<page>谁可以信任我们？在如此不稳定、不稳定的地方，我从未遇到过如此勇敢的昆虫。

original_en_text: Sister, sister! What is that long, gleaming tooth you carry with you? Is it a weapon?<hpage>It is indeed, though you need not fear. I will not raise it against you. Its edge is meant for predators and other foes.<hpage>I strongly suggest you arm yourself similarly before your own journey begins.<page>Alas... for a pilgrim, that’s sin you speak of, sister.<page>We arm ourselves with prayer, garb ourselves in faith, and hope they prove enough to reach the Citadel’s glory. Such is our way...
original_zh_text: 姐妹！你带的闪亮长牙是武器吗？<hpage>正是，但无需惧怕。此刃只与掠食者与敌手相向。<hpage>强烈建议你启程前也备件武器。<page>唉……姐妹此言对朝圣者实属亵渎。我等以祷言为刃，以信仰为盾，唯此方能抵达圣堡。此乃吾辈之道……
translated_text: Sister! Sister!" How are your teeth? Is this a weapon?<hpage>Yes, but that doesn't mean we should be afraid. It will help you fight predators and other enemies.<hpage>We strongly recommend that you arm yourself in the same way before you depart.<page>Yes, right." This is the crime he calls.<page>We can arm ourselves with prayer, dress ourselves with our faith, and we can prepare for the glory of this city.
secondary_translated_text: 姐姐！姐姐！“你的牙齿怎么样了？这是武器吗？<hpage>是的，但这并不意味着我们应该害怕。它将帮助您对抗掠食者和其他敌人。<hpage>我们强烈建议您在出发前以同样的方式武装自己。<page>是的，正确的。“这就是他所说的犯罪。<page>我们可以用祈祷武装自己，用信仰打扮自己，我们可以为这座城市的荣耀做好准备。

original_en_text: Oh! Back again? The wishwall is up! Ready for all the poor souls who’ve been left behind down here.<page>In Pharloom, wishes are granted to those truly devout, or so they say. And there ain’t no harm in us dregs having wishes too.<page>Why, I even went and added a little wish of my own to the wishwall! Fair’s fair. I did build the thing. Seems like the kingdom should be granting my wish before anyone else’s.
original_zh_text: 哦！回来啦？祈愿墙完工了！就等底下这些可怜虫来许愿了。<page>纺络的愿望只赐给真正虔诚的虫，都这么说。但咱这些底层渣滓许个愿总不犯法吧？<page>嘿，我还在墙上偷偷加了自己的小愿望！公平嘛，墙是我造的，圣堡该先实现我的愿望才对。
translated_text: Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Are you back? The wall of wishes is growing to prepare the poor.<page>Wishes are those who talk to really good people, like or hate our shit.<page>I put my little wish on the wall. "Justice is justice, and I have done it, and the kingdom seems to have granted my wishes." "
secondary_translated_text: 哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！你回来了吗？愿望之墙正在增长，为穷人做好准备。<page>愿望是那些与真正优秀的人交谈的人，喜欢或讨厌我们的东西。<page>我把我的小愿望贴在墙上。“正义就是正义，我做到了，王国似乎也满足了我的愿望。" "

original_en_text: <hpage>What’s this you’re building, sir? A sign of some kind?<page>Aye, aye. You’re a sharp bug! A wishwall. It’s past time this old camp had one. As the resident fixer, I’ve taken it upon myself to sort it out.<page>They’re a popular thing about Pharloom, wishwalls. Useful too. So many prayers left unanswered. Gives ‘em a place to go.
original_zh_text: <hpage>先生这是在建造什么？某种标识？<page>啊，好眼力！这是祈愿墙。这老营地早该有一个。身为驻场维修师，自然该由我操办。<page>祈愿墙在纺络可流行了，很实用。那么多没回音的祈愿，总得有个归处。
translated_text: <hpage>What are you doing? What are these symptoms?<page>You are a living insect, a wall of desire. In this ancient place, there is a person who, as professionals, has a responsibility to solve this problem.<page>Pharloom's "Wishing Wall"-Many prayers went unanswered.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>你在干什么？这些症状是什么？<page>你是一只活生生的昆虫，一堵欲望之墙。在这个古老的地方，有一个人，作为专业人士，有责任解决这个问题。<page>法勒姆的“愿望墙”--许多祈祷都没有得到回应。

original_en_text: I must listen carefully... and pray with uninterrupted devotion. Only then will my faith be strong enough... to carry me upward...
original_zh_text: 必须专注聆听……虔心祷告。唯有如此，方能坚定信念，支撑我攀登……
translated_text: Pray it never ends. My confidence is stronger." He accepts them. "
secondary_translated_text: 祈祷它永远不会结束。我的信心更强了。“他接受他们。"

original_en_text: S’not a surprise it’s you rallying us to action, hunter. You had the sense about you, a bug bringing change’n all.<page>Course you’re more than just a bug, aint’cha! More than Weaver. Guess it’d take someone like you for my family to dare hope at success.<page>Go and prove our trust now, won’t you? We’ve spent our lifetimes wishing for another path. With a bit of luck, you might grant it.
original_zh_text: 果然是你来召集我们行动，猎手。我初见便知你是变革者。<page>当然，你并非寻常虫类，也不止是织者。看来只有你这般存在，才让我族敢奢望成功。<page>现在就去证明你值得我们托付吧？我们毕生渴求踏上另一条道路。如果运气眷顾，你或许能成全我们。
translated_text: They feel that they have made their own mistakes that lead to change.<page>Aren't you just a grandma? Actually? It seems that only people like you can pray for the success of our family, but I don't know if that's true.<page>We all want a different path, and if we are lucky, we can do it.
secondary_translated_text: 他们觉得自己犯了导致改变的错误。<page>你不就是个奶奶吗？实际上？似乎只有像你这样的人才能为我们家的成功祈祷，但我不知道这是不是真的。<page>我们都想要一条不同的道路，如果我们幸运的话，我们可以做到。

original_en_text: Well. Though this pilgrim’s name has been lost, still we sing.
original_zh_text: 罢了。虽名讳已失，歌声依旧。
translated_text: Everything is fine, everything is fine, and even if the pilgrim's name disappears, we will continue to sing.
secondary_translated_text: 一切都很好，一切都很好，即使朝圣者的名字消失了，我们也会继续唱歌。

original_en_text: Been hearing awful whispers in camp, about pilgrims driven mad by the hardships of the climb, crying out and attacking their fellows.<page>You’ve been out there. Tell me, is it really so?<hpage>You’ve heard it true, sir. On the roads, both pilgrims and beasts alike are consumed, driven to violence by a haunted thread, the source of which I have yet to discover.<page>Ah... I’d feared it was so. I won’t be able to trust a single face out on the path, then.<page>The risk of death was daunting enough, but the loneliness of such a journey, that seems almost too much to bear... Ah well. Just another test of our devotion, I suppose.
original_zh_text: 营地里常听到些可怖的流言，说攀登艰辛逼疯朝圣者，使其癫狂嚎叫，袭击同伴。<page>你是从外面来的。告诉我，真有这种事？<hpage>传言非虚，先生。路上朝圣者与野兽皆遭丝咒侵蚀，陷入狂暴，其源未明。<page>唉……果然。看来路上谁都不能信了。<page>死亡已经足够可怕，但独行的寂寞……简直难以承受……也罢，这是我等信仰必经的试炼。
translated_text: Inside the camp, I heard the terrible voices of pilgrims, who were crying because of difficulty climbing and attacks on their companions.<page>"There you are, tell me. Is he really here?<hpage>Pilgrims and animals along the way absorbed clues about ghosts and participated in violent acts, but their origins remain unknown.<page>Yes, right. I couldn't believe the faces on the street.<page>The danger of death is terrible, but the loneliness of such a journey seems almost unbearable.
secondary_translated_text: 在营地内，我听到朝圣者可怕的声音，他们因攀登困难和同伴受到袭击而哭泣。<page>“你在这里，告诉我，他真的在这里吗？<hpage>沿途的朝圣者和动物吸收了有关鬼魂的线索并参与了暴力行为，但它们的起源仍然未知。<page>是的，正确的。我简直不敢相信街上的面孔。<page>死亡的危险是可怕的，但这样的旅程的孤独似乎几乎难以忍受。

original_en_text: We pilgrims arm ourselves with prayer, garb ourselves in faith, and hope they prove enough to reach the Citadel’s glory. Such is our way...
original_zh_text: 朝圣者以祷言为刃，披信仰为甲，唯此方能抵达圣堡。此乃吾辈之道……
translated_text: We pilgrims, armed with prayer and dressed in faith, are enough to enjoy the glory of this city.
secondary_translated_text: 我们这些朝圣者，以祈祷为武器，以信仰为衣，足以享受这座城市的荣耀。

original_en_text: <hpage>What duty binds you to this old chapel, madam? The structure barely stands, and I see no signs of congregation.<page>Aye! Gone! The lot’o them, fled and hidden. But I’m not leaving till I’ve set this place right...<page>...It’s that Citadel above, you see. Even now, in Pharloom’s long decline, the simple bugs, they’re witless before it. Too grand. Too majestic. Too powerful.<page>This building’s state is a sad example of those who’d dare suggest another path...
original_zh_text: <hpage>女士，是何职责将你束缚在这破败教堂？此处梁柱倾颓，更无信众踪影。<page>唉！都散了！逃的逃藏的藏。但我要留下……直到把这儿整顿妥当……<page>……你瞧，都是上头圣堡造的孽。即便纺络衰败至此，愚昧虫众仍对其俯首。太宏伟，太威严，太强大。<page>这座建筑的惨状，正是胆敢另辟蹊径者的下场……
translated_text: <hpage>What are your responsibilities to the old church? The building was almost there, with no sign of a meeting.<page>Oh, yes! Oh, yes! You have to leave! Many have fled and gone into hiding, but I will not leave until I have cleansed this place.<page>... In the long decline of the palm tree, even now, these simple mistakes were foolish in the past.<page>For those who dare to propose another path, the state of the building is a sad example.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>你对旧教会负有什么责任？大楼几乎就在那里，没有会议的迹象。<page>哦，是的！哦，是的！你必须离开！许多人已经逃跑躲藏起来，但在我清理这个地方之前，我不会离开。<page>...在棕榈树的长期衰落中，即使是现在，这些简单的错误在过去也是愚蠢的。<page>对于那些敢于提出另一条道路的人来说，建筑物的状况是一个悲伤的例子。

original_en_text: Eh? What fortune is this? Our wish answered, even in a moment so dark!<page>You’ve proved quite the saviour, miss, and you’ve certainly earned the appreciation of this whole sorry lot.<hpage>You are welcome, sir. For you few, I hope these supplies may aid.
original_zh_text: 哎呀！这什么好运？这么黑暗危险的时刻祈愿居然实现了。<page>您真是救星啊小姐，我们这群可怜虫都打心眼里感激您。<hpage>能帮上忙就好。希望这点补给对你们有用。
translated_text: What is this? What are you doing? What is this wealth? Even in these empty days, our wishes have been realized.<page>You have shown us that you are the Savior, and you have received praise from the poor.<hpage>Welcome to the Doctor. I hope this book will be helpful to many people.
secondary_translated_text: 这是什么？你在干什么？这是什么财富？即使在这些空虚的日子里，我们的愿望也实现了。<page>你已经向我们表明你是救主，你已经从穷人那里得到了赞美。<hpage>欢迎来到博士。我希望这本书对很多人有帮助。

original_en_text: You, in the cloak... pray tread softly. I am meditating, gathering my faith... before my pilgrimage begins.<hpage>My steps are soft enough, madam. If I have disturbed you, it was not my intent.<page>Ahh... even your speech... far too loud. I can scarcely hear my thoughts. Please, be away...
original_zh_text: 穿披风那位……脚步放轻。我在冥想聚神……为朝圣做准备。<hpage>脚步够轻了，女士。若打扰了你实非本意。<page>唉……连说话声……都太吵。静不下心。请快离开……
translated_text: Put on your cloak and pray quietly. Confidence is gained through meditation. Before the pilgrimage began.<hpage>My feet are soft, miss, and if you interrupt me, that's not my intention.<page>Yes, right. The same was true of her speech, which was so loud that I could hardly hear my thoughts.
secondary_translated_text: 穿上斗篷，安静地祈祷。通过冥想可以获得信心。在朝圣开始之前。<hpage>我的脚很软，小姐，如果你打断我，那不是我的本意。<page>是的，正确的。她的演讲也是如此，声音太大了，我几乎听不见自己的想法。

original_en_text: I see you’ve gone and opened up the great bone gate back there. And without even asking my permission! Feeling curious, were you?<hpage>There is a vast grave beyond. I’d assumed most bugs died climbing the path, but it seems many fell before their trek had barely commenced.<page>Aye! Lost their lives to beasts, or to luck turned rotten. Others were simply formed too frail.<page>At least those poor souls can rest together. Death and death and death, the eternal promise of our eternal kingdom. Eventually, it claims us all.
original_zh_text: 看来你擅自开了后头的巨大骨门，甚至问都不问我！不怕好奇害死虫？<hpage>门后是片巨冢。本以为众虫多是殒命在攀登途中，但似是有许多死于起步？<page>唉！有的死于猛兽，有的运气不好，也有天生孱弱的。<page>但至少这些可怜虫可以共眠。无止尽的死亡，永恒国度的永恒承诺，终将吞噬众生。
translated_text: So, I saw him open a big bone door and come out, which was really fun, wasn't it? Actually?<hpage>Most of the insects would die when I walked up the trail, but many of them seemed to have fallen off before the hike started.<page>Oh, yes! Oh, yes! Their lives were taken away by animals or destroyed by fate. The image of the other person is very fragile.<page>At least, the poor souls can sleep together. Death is the promise of our eternal kingdom.
secondary_translated_text: 我看到他打开一扇大骨门走出来，很有趣，不是吗？实际上？<hpage>当我沿着小路走时，大多数昆虫都会死去，但其中许多似乎在徒步旅行开始之前就已经掉下来了。<page>哦，是的！哦，是的！他们的生命被动物夺走或被命运摧毁。对方的形象非常脆弱。<page>至少，可怜的灵魂可以睡在一起。死亡是我们永恒王国的承诺。

original_en_text: Hunter! I’m thinking it was you that cleared my basement?<hpage>On first arrival here, the nesting creatures didn’t take kindly to my passing.<page>Ohho. They’re cranky bugs, alright. And they made an awful mess down here with their hatching and breeding.<page>You’ve my many thanks for seeing them off!
original_zh_text: 猎手！地窖里的那些家伙是你清理的？<hpage>初到此地时，那些栖居者可不待见我路过。<page>哈哈，都是些坏脾气的虫子。他们孵卵繁衍把下面搞得一团糟。<page>多谢你赶走了它们！
translated_text: The same goes for hunters. Did you clean the basement?<hpage>When I first came here, the creatures in the nest were not interested in my death.<page>No, no.<page>Thank you for sending me here! "
secondary_translated_text: 猎人也是如此。你打扫地下室了吗？<hpage>当我第一次来到这里时，巢穴里的生物对我的死不感兴趣。<page>不不<page>谢谢你送我来这里！"

original_en_text: <hpage>The bugs of your land, I have watched them, climbing towards their absolution without the flicker of a thought to what it means.<page>Aye. But isn’t it always such for those snared to serve your higher caste?<page>Our mortal mob did once act some defiance, unawares maybe, but successful in part, goaded towards it by Weavers’ will’n all.<hpage>You speak of the Citadel? Its former function has failed, but I can still sense its purpose, some. It is church and cage both.<page>Aye. Devised by your ancestors that monstrosity, and their wicked, clever minds. A system, or a web they’d likely call it, a way to keep their mother sealed in slumber, and themselves free to lavish in their false rule.
original_zh_text: <hpage>我观察了这片土地的虫。他们一心爬向救赎，却不懂这意味着什么。<page>是啊，但被你们高等族群使唤的不都这样。<page>我们凡虫不是没反抗过。当年被织者忽悠着，居然还真成了点事。<hpage>你说圣堡？虽然荒废了，还是能感觉到它的用途：既是教堂又是牢笼。<page>是啊。你祖辈造的这怪物，用狡猾心思织成网，让母亲陷入沉眠，自己却在外面称王。
translated_text: <hpage>"I see insects in your land begging for forgiveness, but I don't know what that means.<page>But that's exactly what all those who serve in the high caste do.<page>The bandits resisted unknowingly, but with Weaver's will and all the motivation, they succeeded.<hpage>Are you talking about a name? Even if previous functions were not successful, goals could still be perceived. This is the church, this is the church.<page>Their ancestors created monsters, evil, intelligent souls that we might call systems or networks, a way to put mothers to sleep and spend their free time following wrong rules.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>“我看到你们土地上的昆虫乞求原谅，但我不知道这意味着什么。<page>但这正是所有在高种姓服役的人所做的。<page>强盗们不知不觉地抵抗了，但凭借韦弗的意志和所有的动力，他们成功了。<hpage>你在说名字吗？即使之前的职能没有成功，目标仍然可以被感知。这是教堂，这是教堂。<page>他们的祖先创造了怪物、邪恶、聪明的灵魂，我们可以称之为系统或网络，这是一种让母亲入睡并按照错误的规则度过空闲时间的方式。

original_en_text: <hpage>Maker, I bring a delivery from Bellhart below, lacquer for your long work.<page>Ahh. Know you distort the order of things, Old One. It is a rare want of your caste to serve us mortal bugs.<hpage>I am not my kin, Maker. I have seen enough pain born of their dominion. As much as I may, I choose to stand apart.<page>If your blood allows it so... And my thanks still for the lacquer. Pharloom’s fresh faces will welcome its sheen.
original_zh_text: <hpage>匠师，我从钟心镇送来漆料，够你用很久。<page>啊呀，古老者，这怎么合适。侍奉我们凡虫可不是你们族群的作风。<hpage>我和同族不一样。看够了他们统治下的苦难，自然不会同流合污。<page>不知您的同族会怎么想……但还是多谢漆料。纺络的新面孔会喜欢的。
translated_text: <hpage>Mr. Manufacturer, I sent you from Belbat to supply ink for your long-term work.<page>"I know you broke the order. Providing worms is a rare wish in the classroom.<hpage>I am not a father or a creator. We have seen enough of the pain your regime has caused.<page>I love painting, as long as my blood allows me. A new face shines under the light of a lamp.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>制造商先生，我从贝尔巴特派您来为您的长期工作提供墨水。<page>“我知道你违反了命令。提供蠕虫是课堂上难得的愿望。<hpage>我不是父亲或创造者。我们已经看到了你们政权造成的痛苦。<page>只要我的血液允许，我就喜欢绘画。一张新面孔在灯光下闪闪发光。

original_en_text: Until cavern’s collapse, the masks must be made!
original_zh_text: 直到洞窟崩塌，雕刻都不能停！
translated_text: Wear a mask before you fall.

original_en_text: Enough talk, Old One. My contract remains. I’ll work till caverns’ collapse.<hpage>Very well, Maker. If it is within my power to do so, I shall see your lands saved.
original_zh_text: 聊够了吧，古老者。契约还在，我要继续刻面甲，直到大地崩塌。<hpage>好吧，匠师。要是有办法，我会保护好这片土地。
translated_text: My contract is still valid and I will continue to work until the cave collapses.<hpage>Great, manufacturer, if I can do this, I can save your country. "
secondary_translated_text: 我的合同仍然有效，我将继续工作直到洞穴倒塌。<hpage>太好了，制造商，如果我能做到这一点，我就能拯救你们的国家。"

original_en_text: Ahh. Old One. Your kind should know it’s rude to expose me such. Unmasked, the task becomes heavy. <hpage>I had the desire to hear you lucid, Maker, though you may protest.<page>Aye. Well its no great shock to have you visit. I’ve felt the stirrings of our monarch, even all the way out here, the tremors of her kin brought close.<page>You’re planning a confrontation with her then? The one atop? Our great, frayed god?<hpage>Our meeting seems inevitable, though first I seek the strength to ensure a favourable outcome.<page>Ha! As I’d have guessed! Your ancient kind aren’t told to abide one another peaceably.<page>Well, assuming you prevail, I’ll ask only that my labour may continue. No matter the state of these lands, you should well know the necessity of my service.
original_zh_text: 啊呀，古老者，你们这一族最清楚，不戴面甲交谈太失礼了。<hpage>我就是想和清醒的你聊聊，别见怪。<page>好吧。不过我倒是不奇怪你会来。连我这都能感觉到那位的躁动，想必就是因为你。<page>所以你打算要去她算账？找我们伟大却又衰败的女王？<hpage>迟早要见，但我得先积蓄力量。<page>哈！早猜到了！你们古族从来都是窝里斗。<page>要是你赢了，我只求能继续刻面甲。无论王国结局如何，我的活都不能停。
translated_text: Oh, old man, people like you should know how impolitely I exposed myself. Once the veil is torn, the task becomes difficult.<hpage>I can protest, but I want to hear your clear voice, creator.<page>Although my parents 'fears were getting closer, I could feel the excitement of our monarch.<page>Are you arguing with her? Do you want to come up? God is tired and tired.<hpage>Negotiations seemed inevitable, but first, we found the strength to achieve favorable results.<page>Oh! Oh! Just as I imagined it! Elderly people are not invited to live in peace.<page>If I win, I will continue to work regardless of the conditions on earth.
secondary_translated_text: 哎呀，老头，像你这样的人应该知道我是多么无礼地暴露自己。一旦面纱被撕破，任务就会变得困难。<hpage>我可以抗议，但我想听到你清晰的声音，创造者。<page>尽管父母的恐惧越来越近，但我能感受到我们君主的兴奋。<page>你在和她争论吗？你想上来吗？上帝又累又累。<hpage>谈判似乎不可避免，但首先，我们找到了取得有利结果的力量。<page>哦！哦！正如我想象的那样！老年人不被邀请过平静的生活。<page>如果我赢了，无论地球上的条件如何，我都会继续工作。

original_en_text: Back again, Old One? The effects of your... altercation with the pale mother... those are plainly sensed. The fate for these caverns feels grim.<page>I’ll take it things have taken a turn more complicated? Or was this the aftermath anticipated all along?<hpage>In our meeting, a mortal blow was dealt, but the monarch’s desperate death throes now threaten to take this whole kingdom with her.<page>Ha! I’m not surprised! It’s always the way, aye? Your ancient kind, vying for dominion, and us mortal bugs squashed unseen underneath.<hpage>It was freedom I sought, Maker. Naive perhaps, but this is not the fate I wished to come.
original_zh_text: 又来了古老者？我感觉到了你和苍白女王争斗……不过看来情况不太妙。<page>我猜事情变得复杂了？还是说你早料到会这样？<hpage>我给了她致命一击，可她临死挣扎要让整个王国陪葬。<page>哈！一点都不意外！你们古族争权夺利，我们小虫子活该被碾碎。<hpage>我想要自由，匠师。既为了我也为了你们。或许是有些天真，但这不是我要的结局。
translated_text: "You're back, old man? "" Of course, the flu was so pale that I had to fight with my mother. "<page>Do you think things are going to get more and more complicated? Or is this what we expect?<hpage>We suffered a fatal blow during the meeting, but the desperate grief of the monarch's death threatened the entire kingdom.<page>Oh! Oh! I'm not surprised! It's always been like this, isn't it? What are you doing? As ancient species compete for dominance, human insects are being pushed out of view.<hpage>This is the freedom I seek, Creator. I know this may sound naive, but this is not the fate I want.
secondary_translated_text: “你回来了，老头？”“当然，流感太苍白了，我不得不和妈妈一起战斗。"<page>你认为事情会变得越来越复杂吗？或者这就是我们所期望的？<hpage>会议期间我们遭受了致命的打击，但君主去世的绝望悲伤却威胁着整个王国。<page>哦！哦！我并不惊讶！一直都是这样的，不是吗？你在干什么？随着古代物种争夺主导地位，人类昆虫正在被赶出人们的视野。<hpage>这就是我寻求的自由，创造者。我知道这听起来可能很天真，但这不是我想要的命运。

original_en_text: All deserve a face. A chance to be! Until I wither, for the faceless I shall provide.
original_zh_text: 所有生灵都该有张脸，有机会存在！只要我还没倒下，就会给无面者造脸。
translated_text: Everyone has a face, a face, a face dead.
secondary_translated_text: 每个人都有一张脸，一张脸，一张死了的脸。

original_en_text: To exist, to die, a face is needed. It is the essential thing.
original_zh_text: 不论死活，都得有一张脸。这是根本。
translated_text: We need a face to survive, and that's all that matters.
secondary_translated_text: 我们需要一张脸才能生存，这才是最重要的。

original_en_text: <hpage>Maker, I bring a delivery from Bellhart below, lacquer for your long work. <page>Good! Good! To seal. To protect. May Pharloom’s fresh faces gleam bright.
original_zh_text: <hpage>匠师，我从钟心镇送来漆料，够你用很久。<page>好！好！用来封存，用来保护。让纺络的新面孔闪闪发亮。
translated_text: <hpage>Mr. Manufacturer, I sent you from Belbat to supply ink for your long-term work.<page>I'm okay, I'm okay! Okay, okay! Okay! Closed for conservation reasons, Mae Farrow's new face is shining.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>制造商先生，我从贝尔巴特派您来为您的长期工作提供墨水。<page>我没事，我没事！好吧，好吧！好的！由于保护原因关闭，梅·法罗的新面孔闪闪发光。

original_en_text: Take reward for service made, visitor! Gift for you, to spend or treasure!
original_zh_text: 收下报酬吧客人！要用掉还是收着都行！
translated_text: Visitors will receive compensation for the services provided. Gifts are worth using or deserved!
secondary_translated_text: 游客将因所提供的服务获得补偿。礼物值得使用或应得！

original_en_text: A visitor! Grand you are. But you have already a mask. Already a face. It is for those without that I must carve.
original_zh_text: 欢迎！尊贵的客人。可你已经有面甲了，已经有脸了。我的刻刀只为无面者服务。
translated_text: Visitors! You're fine, but you're wearing a mask. I already have a face.
secondary_translated_text: 访客！你很好，但你戴着口罩。我已经有脸了。

original_en_text: To work! To work! The masks must be carved.
original_zh_text: 雕刻！雕刻！必须继续雕刻面甲。
translated_text: Let him work! Go to work! The mask will be carved.
secondary_translated_text: 让他工作！去上班吧！面具将被雕刻。

original_en_text: Did you treat with the creature upon the summit?<page>Your legged ancestors once found her company compelling, enough to build their chambers and their calling device at the height of this perilous peak.<hpage>I have paid my respects, and been granted her favour. Her down now fills my cloak, and does much to ward against the frost of these heights.<page>To pass something so precious... That’s a mighty gift you’ve been given. Seems she’s thrown her lot in with you.<page>I’d not have guessed her so opposed to our threaded monarch, but then she too must have sensed the wretched state of things, and the harsher change to come.
original_zh_text: 见过山顶上那位了吗？<page>你那些多足的先祖对她十分信服，甚至在这么险的山峰上修了屋子打造机器。<hpage>我去拜访过了，也受到了她的青睐，得了这身御寒的绒毛。<page>连这个都送你……真是下了血本。她把宝押在你身上了。<page>没想到她这么反对苍白之主，恐怕她也看出纺络情况不对，有大事要发生了。
translated_text: Have you ever seen creatures on the mountains?<page>His ancestors discovered the charm of the company building and the rooms of telephone equipment on this dangerous hill.<hpage>Its feathers fill my coat and help me withstand such high ice.<page>Giving away precious things is a powerful gift you will receive, and she seems to have given her destiny to him.<page>I didn't expect her to talk so loudly about our damn monarch, but I felt poverty and the inevitable deeper changes.
secondary_translated_text: 你见过山上的生物吗？<page>他的祖先在这座危险的山上发现了公司大楼和电话设备房间的魅力。<hpage>它的羽毛布满了我的外套，帮助我抵御如此高的冰。<page>放弃珍贵的东西是你将收到的一份强大的礼物，她似乎已经把自己的命运交给了他。<page>我没想到她会这么大声地谈论我们该死的君主，但我感受到了贫困和不可避免的更深层次的变化。

original_en_text: Ahh. Old One. Your kind should know it’s rude to expose me such. Unmasked, the task becomes heavy. <hpage>I had the desire to hear you lucid, Maker, though you may protest.<page>Aye. Well its no great shock to have you visit. I’ve felt, and heard, the effects of your... altercation with the pale mother... The fate for these caverns seems grim.<page>I’ll take it things have taken a turn more complicated? Or was this the aftermath anticipated all along?<hpage>In our meeting, a mortal blow was dealt, but the monarch’s desperate death throes now threaten to take this whole kingdom with her.<page>Ha! I’m not surprised! It’s always the way, aye? Your ancient kind, vying for dominion, and us mortal bugs squashed unseen underneath.<hpage>It was freedom I sought, Maker, for myself and for you mortal few. Naive perhaps, but this is not the fate I wished to come.
original_zh_text: 啊呀，古老者，你们这一族最清楚，不戴面甲交谈太失礼了。<hpage>我就是想和清醒的你聊聊，别见怪。<page>好吧。不过我倒是不奇怪你会来。我感觉到、听到了你和苍白女王争斗……不过看来情况不太妙。<page>我猜事情变得复杂了？还是说你早料到会这样？<hpage>我给了她致命一击，可她临死挣扎要让整个王国陪葬。<page>哈！一点都不意外！你们古族争权夺利，我们小虫子活该被碾碎。<hpage>我想要自由，匠师。既为了我也为了你们。或许是有些天真，但这不是我要的结局。
translated_text: Ancient thing. Do you know how rude I am? "When the veil is torn, it becomes more difficult.<hpage>I can protest, but I want to hear your clear voice, creator.<page>No wonder you are here. You have already felt its impact. The cave's destiny seems heavy: fighting an innocent mother.<page>Do you think things are going to get more and more complicated? Or is this what we expect?<hpage>We suffered a fatal blow during the meeting, but the desperate grief of the monarch's death threatened the entire kingdom.<page>Oh! Oh! I'm not surprised! It's always been like this, isn't it? What are you doing? As ancient species compete for dominance, human insects are being pushed out of view.<hpage>My Creator, pray for freedom, pray for freedom.
secondary_translated_text: 古老的东西。你知道我有多粗鲁吗？“当面纱被撕破时，事情就会变得更加困难。<hpage>我可以抗议，但我想听到你清晰的声音，创造者。<page>难怪你在这里。您已经感受到了它的影响。洞穴的命运似乎很沉重：与一位无辜的母亲作斗争。<page>你认为事情会变得越来越复杂吗？或者这就是我们所期望的？<hpage>会议期间我们遭受了致命的打击，但君主去世的绝望悲伤却威胁着整个王国。<page>哦！哦！我并不惊讶！一直都是这样的，不是吗？你在干什么？随着古代物种争夺主导地位，人类昆虫正在被赶出人们的视野。<hpage>我的造物主，为自由祈祷，为自由祈祷。

original_en_text: Late! Late you are! And already a mask. Already a face. It is for those without that I must carve.
original_zh_text: 迟了！太迟了！你已经有面甲了，已经有脸了。我的刻刀只为无面者服务。
translated_text: You're late! I was late, she had a mask on, I had a face, and I had to make a sculpture for those who didn't have a mask.
secondary_translated_text: 你迟到了！我迟到了，她戴着面具，我也有脸，我必须为那些没有面具的人做一个雕塑。

original_en_text: Have some small reward for your troubles, Old One. It’s no small thing to deliver that sloshing stuff safe, ‘specially all the way up here.
original_zh_text: 古老者，请收下这点酬劳。抱着晃荡的漆罐爬这么高不容易。
translated_text: The safety of handling shock-sensitive items is no small matter. Especially here.
secondary_translated_text: 处理冲击敏感物品的安全性并非小事。尤其是在这里。

original_en_text: A fine face, yours. Not of my work. Not of this kingdom’s craft. Not now at least.<page>But the deeper form. Distant relationship. Some form of Pharloom and our old, legged, stewards. <page>Now! To work. To work! The masks are needed.
original_zh_text: 你这张脸不错。不是我的手艺，也不是纺络的手艺。至少现在不是。<page>但更深处，有渊源。和古时候那些多足管事的一样。<page>好了！干活！干活！需要更多面甲！
translated_text: Your face is beautiful, not my work, nor the art of the kingdom, at least for now.<page>In a deeper sense, long-distance relationships are the long-legged housewives and our old Farr.<page>Come on, now! Work now! You need a mask.
secondary_translated_text: 你的脸很漂亮，不是我的作品，也不是王国的艺术，至少目前是这样。<page>从更深层次的意义上说，异地关系就是长腿家庭主妇和我们的老法尔。<page>快点，现在！现在工作！你需要一个口罩。

original_en_text: <hpage>You have the sight, Maker. Tell me what you see in me?<page>Your mask... It reads clear enough, Old One. Watcher, hunter, monarch even, though you may reject that station.<page>A complex visage, perhaps, yet still to my sight it looks unresolved.<hpage>If you see a transitional state, it is one I have accepted. My mask has remained defined through lifetimes uncounted.<page>Aye. Rigid I’m sure, but your kind rarely develop evenly, and the lifetime of bugs are poor measure for one like you.<page>Could be there’s more growth awaiting you yet...
original_zh_text: <hpage>匠师好眼力。在我身上看到什么了？<page>你的面甲……上面清清楚楚。守望者，猎手，甚至君主——就算你不认最后这个。<page>挺复杂的一张脸，但在我看来还没定型。<hpage>如果是过渡状态，那我早已接受。这面甲已陪我度过了不知多少辈子的时间。<page>是啊。不过你们古族生长发育不合常理，我们虫子的几辈子可没法衡量你的年纪。<page>说不定你还能再长大呢……
translated_text: <hpage>My creator, I have a vision.<page>Wearing masks, elders, guards, hunters and even kings can refuse this place.<page>It may be a difficult face, but in my opinion it has not been decided yet.<hpage>When I see change, and it's the change I accept, the mask will remain in shape for the rest of my life.<page>Sure, it's hard, but people like you can't develop in almost the same way, and life for worms is worse for people like you.<page>Maybe he is waiting to grow.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>我的创造者，我有一个远见。<page>戴着面具，长辈、卫兵、猎人甚至国王都可以拒绝这个地方。<page>这可能是一个艰难的面孔，但在我看来还没有决定。<hpage>当我看到变化，而且是我接受的变化时，面具将在我的余生中保持状态。<page>当然，这很难，但像你这样的人不可能以几乎相同的方式发展，而蠕虫的生活对于像你这样的人来说更糟糕。<page>也许他正在等待成长。

original_en_text: Our world cries its end! But the masks must still be carved.

original_en_text: Ho, traveller! With the lands outside fresh struck by fell events, it’s good to see someone still survivin’.<hpage>This new curse proves a threat even to my strengthened shell. For your own safety, barkeep, I strongly suggest you remain within your walls.<page>Aye, well, you’re welcome to do the same. Stay and wash the troubles away with a few bells of nectar... though, given the scale to them shakes, I’m thinkin’ it might take more’n just a few.
original_zh_text: 噢，旅行者！您没事吧？外头刚遭了灾，能见到还活着的虫子真让我宽心。<hpage>酒保先生，劝你最好待在屋内。这新的诅咒连我的甲壳都扛不住。<page>您说的对，您要乐意也可以留下。喝几盏蜜露压压惊……不过看这地动山摇的架势，怕得喝光我的存货才够压惊的。
translated_text: My travel partner! I'm happy to see people alive because the outer layer has just been removed.<hpage>This new curse threatens my modified shell.<page>You will stop and sweat a few times, but given the intensity of these vibrations, you may need more vibrations.
secondary_translated_text: 我的旅行伙伴！我很高兴看到人们还活着，因为外层刚刚被去除。<hpage>这个新诅咒威胁着我修改后的外壳。<page>你会停下来出汗几次，但考虑到这些振动的强度，你可能需要更多的振动。

original_en_text: Phew. You’re lookin’ a bit raw there, miss. I’m thinkin’ it’ll take more than my nectar to fix you up.<hpage>A parasite of your land has twisted itself into my shell. Its writhing is causing some discomfort.<hpage>If not for my unique constitution, I suspect it would have already consumed me entirely.<page>Well, don’t be bringing such dangerous things in here! Head to the top of the moors. There’s an old doctor up there hiding in her bell.<page>Her remedies are said to often hurt more’n they help, but given your state, I’d say it’s worth the risk.
original_zh_text: 嚯，您看着不太对劲啊，小姐。光靠我的蜜露，可治不了您这毛病。<hpage>我的甲壳里钻入了寄生物，它的蠕动使我不太舒服。<hpage>若不是体质特殊，我可能早被啃噬干净了。<page>啊，别把这种危险的玩意带到我这来！赶紧去沼泽的顶部，那里有一位老医生！她躲在一口钟里。<page>虽说她开的药往往比疾病本身的危害还大，但您这状况值得赌一把。
translated_text: I think it's a bit raw, and I don't think sweat can cure it.<hpage>The parasites on your land are buried in my shell.<hpage>Without my body, I would completely devour my body.<page>"Please don't bring something so dangerous. In a few hours, there will be an old woman in the desert.<page>I often say your treatment is more harmful, but considering your situation, I think it's worth the risk.
secondary_translated_text: 我觉得有点生，而且我不认为出汗可以治愈它。<hpage>你土地上的寄生虫都埋在我的壳里了。<hpage>如果没有我的身体，我会彻底吞噬我的身体。<page>“请不要带这么危险的东西。几个小时后，沙漠里就会出现一位老妇人。<page>我经常说你的治疗更有害，但考虑到你的情况，我认为值得冒这个风险。

original_en_text: <hpage>Bartender, I’ve been tasked to acquire a nectar of significant age. Would you retain any such drink?<page>After the finer stuff, eh? Sure, I might have a few vessels left, but I can’t be selling ‘em cheap.<page>The shells in my cellar are the last left in Pharloom. Once they’re gone, no bug’ll ever taste such sweetness again.
original_zh_text: <hpage>酒保先生，我在找储存多年的蜜露。你这儿可有存货？<page>嘴巴越来越刁了，小姐？我这应该还剩几瓶，但价钱可不便宜。<page>我地窖里的存货可是纺络最后的陈酿。喝完之后，再也没有虫子能享受到此等蜜酿咯。
translated_text: <hpage>My task is to prepare honey.<page>When there's something better, isn't there? Of course, you can leave the boat, but you can't sell it cheaply.<page>The shells in my basement were the last thing left in the corridor. Once it's gone, insects no longer like sweetness.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>我的任务是准备蜂蜜。<page>当有更好的东西时，不是吗？当然，你可以离开船，但你不能廉价出售。<page>我地下室里的贝壳是走廊里剩下的最后一样东西。一旦它消失了，昆虫就不再喜欢甜味了。

original_en_text: <hpage>Another time, perhaps. Among the few gifts of my birth, I find rare need for sustenance.<page>S’at so? Well the nectar’s always on tap if you find yourself feelin’ different.
original_zh_text: <hpage>改日吧。我这副躯壳生来特殊，少有饥渴之时。<page>这样吗？蜜露随时管够，想来一盏就招呼我一声。
translated_text: <hpage>Secondly, we realized that we were born with a small talent and we didn't need to remain profitable.<page>Is that so? Otherwise, honey is easy to use.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>其次，我们意识到我们生来就才华横溢，不需要保持盈利。<page>是这样吗？否则，蜂蜜很好用。

original_en_text: <page>Thinkin’ again on the Vintage Nectar?<page>My price might seem steep, but I assure you, the few finer bugs who passed used to pay a lot more.
original_zh_text: <page>还惦记着陈年蜜露？<page>别看我现在出的价高，之前路过的阔绰顾客给得更多呢！
translated_text: <page>Do you want Sam back?<page>My price may seem high, but I can be sure that some of the worst mistakes I have made in the past have paid off more.
secondary_translated_text: <page>你想让萨姆回来吗？<page>我的代价可能看起来很高，但我可以肯定，我过去犯下的一些最严重的错误已经得到了更多的回报。

original_en_text: Any chance you’d reconsider dealing with my blasted craw problem? I’d offer fair reward for your efforts.
original_zh_text: 真不打算帮我收拾房顶上的麻烦？酬劳保证让您满意。
translated_text: Think about my discomfort and I will reward you for your efforts.
secondary_translated_text: 想想我的不适，我会奖励你的努力。

original_en_text: Traveller, I’m not wanting to impose, but I’ve a wish that one of your able sort could likely grant.<hpage>I’ve my own task to attend, good sir, but I’ll hear you out.<page>It’s those blasted craws atop here. My roof is fast becoming their cosy nest! Now they’ve grown so bold they’re starting to attack pilgrims as they pass.<hpage>Would you simply have them slain? If so, your sturdy shell seems more than up to that task?<page>If only it were so simple. Kill the ones above, and more just keep coming. It’s the warmth of this home you see. Draws ‘em right in.<page>I’m looking for a long-term solution. A scarecraw! I’ll build the biggest there’s ever been, so fearsome it’ll keep those craws away for good!
original_zh_text: 旅行者，本不该劳烦您，但有件事非得您这样的利落角色才能办。<hpage>虽然我还有自己的事要去做，但请说吧，先生。<page>您看到房顶上那群腐囊虫了吗？它们快把我这儿当成自己的窝了！最近胆子越来越肥，已经开始攻击过路的朝圣者了。<hpage>你是想直接把它们杀光？看你这身强健的躯壳，办这事应该不费劲吧？<page>要这么简单就好了。杀完一茬又来一茬，全怪我这酒馆太暖和，招虫子。<page>得想个一劳永逸的办法——扎个巨型稻草人！保准吓得它们再不敢靠近！
translated_text: Traveler, I don't want to force anyone, but I hope you understand this.<hpage>I have my job, but you will feel it.<page>The crab fell. My roof will be your refuge. They grew brave and began attacking passing pilgrims.<hpage>Do you want to kill them? If so, is stable expansion enough?<page>I wish it were that simple. If you kill more than one, you will get more. Look how hot the house is! You have direct attraction.<page>We are looking for a long-term solution. I know I've tried my best, it's so scary, you can stay away from crabs forever!
secondary_translated_text: 旅行者，我不想强迫任何人，但我希望你明白这一点。<hpage>我有我的工作，但你会感觉到的。<page>螃蟹掉了下来。我的屋顶将成为你的避难所。他们变得勇敢起来，开始袭击路过的朝圣者。<hpage>你想杀了他们吗？如果是这样，稳定扩张就足够了吗？<page>我希望事情就这么简单。如果你杀了不止一个，你就会得到更多。看看房子有多热！你有直接的吸引力。<page>我们正在寻找长期解决方案。我知道我已经尽力了，太可怕了，你可以永远远离螃蟹了！

original_en_text: Tis a blessed bit of luck to find this place, eh, sister?<page>The climb’s proved harder than even my best guessin’, but there’s still some vigour left in these old limbs. Doubly so, now I have a belly full of nectar!
original_zh_text: 能找着这酒馆，真算撞大运了！<page>这段攀登比我预想的还要艰难，但我这副老甲壳里仍然残存着些许活力。如今，狠狠灌上几盏蜜露，更是精神倍增！
translated_text: "You are very lucky to find this place, sister.<page>It was tough, but the former participants were still full of energy. "
secondary_translated_text: “姐姐，你很幸运找到这个地方。<page>这很艰难，但前参与者仍然充满活力。"

original_en_text: Care for a drink, traveller? My nectar’s got a kick that’ll warm your shell in these sodden climes.
original_zh_text: 旅行者，来盏蜜露暖暖身子？这地方湿气重，而我的蜜露最能驱寒。
translated_text: Would you like something to drink, my friend? Honey can help you stay as warm as possible.
secondary_translated_text: 朋友，你想喝点什么吗？蜂蜜可以帮助您尽可能保持温暖。

original_en_text: Hoy... sister! I’m sat here all bent and bedraggled, but you look fresh as the day you was hatched!<page>How do you fare so well in these drenched and dangerous lands? Maybe you got a secret you could share?<hpage>None that would offer easy aid, good bug. Whatever luck or savvy brought you this far, may it continue on your journey.
original_zh_text: 嘿……小姐！我这破甲壳疼得我直不起腰，你的倒鲜亮得像是刚破卵而出！<page>在这种鬼地方你怎么保养的？有啥秘诀能透露不？<hpage>没有什么秘诀，在这种地方只能靠自己，无论靠的是运气还是智慧。
translated_text: Good morning, sister! I'm sitting in a filthy place, but you look as fresh as the day you were destroyed! "<page>What are you doing in this humid and dangerous place? I know she has a secret.<hpage>No one can easily help you, that's a mistake. No matter how lucky you are, even if you understand this, I hope you can continue your journey.
secondary_translated_text: 早上好，姐姐！我坐在一个肮脏的地方，但你看起来和被摧毁的那天一样新鲜！"<page>你在这个潮湿危险的地方做什么？我知道她有一个秘密。<hpage>没有人可以轻易帮助你，这是一个错误。无论你有多幸运，即使你明白这一点，我也希望你能够继续你的旅程。

original_en_text: <hpage>For now, bartender, I cannot spare so many rosaries.<page>Suit yourself. Maybe you’d rather a pour of the cheap stuff? Give your shell a kick before you head out into our blighted lands.
original_zh_text: <hpage>酒保先生，眼下我拿不出这么多念珠。<page>没关系，那来盏便宜货？出发前给自己壮壮胆。
translated_text: <hpage>"I can't remove so many rosary beads from that wall.<page>Want a cheap drink? Remove your helmet before entering the infected area.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>“我无法从那面墙上取下这么多念珠。<page>想要便宜的饮料吗？进入受感染区域之前请摘下头盔。

original_en_text: <hpage>My travels took me through a town beside your moors, in a vein of old bells. Its residents are bound upon a vicious thread.<page>Ahh. So Pharloom’s curse has strung’em tight. A frightful thing. Word’d long gone silent from over their way.<hpage>I suggest you pass warning to your patrons, bartender. If they’re travelling the bellside paths, best they give that place wide berth.<page>Aye. I’ll let’em know, traveller, though in these cursed times, does any safe path still exist?
original_zh_text: <hpage>我路过了一个位于古老钟脉里的小镇，就在这片沼泽旁边，那里的居民全被凶恶的丝线缠绕着。<page>啊……纺络的诅咒把那儿的虫子紧紧束缚，可怕得很。那镇上很久就没有音讯传出来过了。<hpage>酒保先生，我建议你提醒客人们，若是要走钟脉边的小道，务必离那地方远点。<page>没问题，旅行者。不过话说回来，如今这世道哪还有安全的路哟。
translated_text: <hpage>My journey passed through a village near the desert where ancient papers hung.<page>The pharaoh's curse bound them very heavily. Something terrible. The news was silent.<hpage>Tell this to the bartender. If you are walking on the street next to the Bell Tower, it is best to stay away from the area.<page>Yes, I'll let you know. Do travelers have a safe route at this damn moment?
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>我的旅程经过沙漠附近的一个村庄，那里挂着古老的纸张。<page>法老的诅咒深深地束缚了他们。一些可怕的事情。消息悄无声息。<hpage>把这个告诉酒保。如果您走在钟楼旁边的街道上，最好远离该地区。<page>是的，我会告诉你的。此时此刻，旅行者有安全的路线吗？

original_en_text: Best be visiting that doctor right quick, miss! She’s up there, at the top of the moors, over toward the bellvein.<page>Her methods might be suspect, but you’re lookin’ sorely in need of service.
original_zh_text: 小姐，您最好赶紧去看医生！就在沼泽顶部的钟脉附近。<page>虽然她的治疗方法很是邪乎，但您这身子骨可拖不起。
translated_text: You should see a doctor first! He stood high in the desert, looking for his watch.<page>There can be problems on the road, but it requires a lot of maintenance.
secondary_translated_text: 你应该先去看医生！他站在沙漠高处，寻找他的手表。<page>路上可能会出现问题，但需要大量的维护。

original_en_text: Might have taken me a beat to build the courage, but I can feel it, closer now... the Citadel calling me up.
original_zh_text: 我可能得多喝点才能鼓足勇气，继续上路了。但我能感觉到，圣堡离我更近了……它在顶上呼唤我呢。
translated_text: Courage may have been a heavy blow, but now the nearest castle is calling me.
secondary_translated_text: 勇气可能是一个沉重的打击，但现在最近的城堡正在召唤我。

original_en_text: <hpage>Here is the Ragpelt, sir. I hope the amount is sufficient for your work.<page>Aye. This should be enough. Once I find a quiet moment, I’ll get straight to building that mighty scarecraw.<page>With a little luck, my roof should be clear of those pests when next you pass by. Thank you kindly, traveller!
original_zh_text: <hpage>酒保先生，这些是你要的破毛皮。希望足够帮你制作稻草人。<page>够了够了！等我腾出手就去扎稻草人。<page>运气好的话，待你下次路过时，房顶应该已经清静了。衷心感谢你，旅者！
translated_text: <hpage>This is Ragfeld! I wish I had enough money to work.<page>If you find a minute of silence, immediately make that powerful silence.<page>If you're lucky, the next time you pass my roof, you won't see any parasites.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>这是拉格菲尔德！我希望我有足够的钱来工作。<page>如果您默哀一分钟，请立即进行强烈的沉默。<page>如果你幸运的话，下次你经过我的屋顶时，你不会看到任何寄生虫。

original_en_text: If you’re collecting Ragpelt from the crawbugs, those young’ns above here’ll be slim pickings. It’s the mature craws you want, over by the watermound. They’ll drop the stuff a-plenty.<page>Course, you’ll need to do some pointed persuading if you’re planning to separate rag from bug...
original_zh_text: 要收集腐囊虫的破毛皮，房顶那些小崽子可不够用。去水丘旁边找成年腐囊虫，它们身上有更多的货。<page>当然，你得用点“尖锐”的手段，才能让它们乖乖交出毛皮……
translated_text: If you are collecting crab shells, the above body is another option. This is the mature crab you want. Throw a mountain next to a water mountain.<page>Of course, considering the difference between garbage and insects, a certain degree of confidence is needed.
secondary_translated_text: 如果您正在收集蟹壳，上面的身体是另一种选择。这就是您想要的成熟螃蟹。在水山旁边扔一座山。<page>当然，考虑到垃圾和昆虫的区别，需要一定程度的信心。

original_en_text: You’re back, miss! Heard a little commotion below. I trust everything went... erm, smoothly?<hpage><hpage>Sir, your cellar seems to have an ant problem. I assume, in sending me down, it merely slipped your mind to mention?<page>Ah... Oh yes! Well, with your weapon, and talent, and what... I’m sure they didn’t pose a problem? Ahem.<page>And why! I see you’ve collected your prize, so we’ve both come out well from the trade!<page>Enjoy your nectar, miss. No simple pilgrim will ever taste a drop so fine.
original_zh_text: 小姐，您回来啦！底下动静不小……没出什么岔子吧？<hpage><hpage>先生，你家地窖闹蚂蚁，怎么不提前知会？<page>哎！您这身手……小小蚂蚁肯定不在话下嘛！是吧？<page>啊哈！我看您也得到了战利品，这笔交易对咱们双方都算得上圆满！<page>小姐，好好享受这瓶蜜露吧。这滋味普通的朝圣者可尝不着。
translated_text: When you get home, you hear riots, and you think it's over, don't you? Do you agree?<hpage><hpage>Did you forget to tell me about the ant problem in the basement?<page>Yes, right. Oh, yes! They use weapons and talent. Are there really no problems? Cough (Cough)<page>Why? I think I won.<page>I hope you enjoy your drink.
secondary_translated_text: 当你回到家时，你听到骚乱，你认为一切都结束了，不是吗？你同意吗？<hpage><hpage>你忘记告诉我地下室的蚂蚁问题了吗？<page>是的，正确的。哦，是的！他们使用武器和天赋。真的没有问题吗？咳嗽（咳嗽）<page>为什么？我想我赢了。<page>我希望你喜欢你的饮料。

original_en_text: Ahh. Fair enough, traveller. You’ve clearly got your own tasks to be on with. I’ll manage, no doubt.
original_zh_text: 唉，理解理解。你毕竟有要事在身，我再想想办法吧。
translated_text: "Yes, traveler, of course, homework at home. I'll take care of it, of course.
secondary_translated_text: “是的，旅行者，当然是家里的作业。当然，我会处理好的。

original_en_text: As payment goes, I’ve got something I think you’d make good use of. A spare crafting kit.<page>I’d been holding onto it for someone else, but they’ve been gone long enough now, I know they won’t be returning.
original_zh_text: 酬劳的话，我这有个东西，您应该能用得上——一个多余的制作匣。<page>本来这是要留给别人的，但那位怕是已经回不来了。
translated_text: Payment is in progress, but I think you might benefit from it.<page>I've booked seats for others, but I know they won't come back because they won't be here long.
secondary_translated_text: 付款正在进行中，但我认为您可能会从中受益。<page>我已经为其他人预订了座位，但我知道他们不会回来，因为他们不会在这里呆太久。

original_en_text: <hpage>Thank you sir. This is a worthy trade for my work. My tools shall attain an even sharper edge.
original_zh_text: <hpage>多谢先生。这东西对我很有帮助，我的工具将更加锋锐。
translated_text: <hpage>Thank you, it gave me a lot of understanding of my work. This tool is sharp.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>谢谢，这让我对自己的工作有了很多了解。这个工具很锋利。

original_en_text: My sore shell will cease tormenting me once I reach the Citadel. It’s sung that all ails are healed just as soon as we step beyond the Grand Gate...
original_zh_text: 现在疼就疼点吧，等我到达圣堡，这一切都不是问题了。据说所有的痛苦都会在迈入巨扉圣门后烟消云散……
translated_text: When I arrived at the castle, I was told that if I walked through this door, all my illnesses would be cured, but the pain no longer bothered me.
secondary_translated_text: 当我到达城堡时，有人告诉我，如果我走进这扇门，我所有的疾病都会被治愈，但疼痛不再困扰我。

original_en_text: Aye. A fair trade. The aged stuff’s down at the bottom of the cellar.<page>I’ll trust you to collect only the vessel you’re owed. I’d be grabbing it myself, but it’s become a hard climb for my stiffened shell.
original_zh_text: 好嘞，成交。陈酿在地窖最底层。<page>我这副甲壳现在僵硬了不少，不方便上上下下的。劳烦您自个儿去取。我相信您是不会多拿的，对吧？
translated_text: It was an honest deal, the old man was already on the ground.<page>I took it myself, but it became more difficult because my shell was so hard.
secondary_translated_text: 这是一笔诚实的交易，老人已经倒在地上了。<page>我自己拿了，但因为我的壳太硬了，所以变得更加困难。

original_en_text: S’only those few stronger pilgrims that survive to reach my home now... Pharloom’s curse claims the rest. Poor sods, left to wander.<page>I do sometimes get to wondering... Is it the dregs of their own mind in there keepin’em walking, or something else entirely...?
original_zh_text: 如今能来到我这儿的，大多是足够强大的朝圣者……剩下的都被纺络的诅咒害成游魂了。<page>我有时候会想……是他们自己残存的意识在支撑行走呢，还是别的什么鬼东西在作祟……？
translated_text: Several powerful pilgrims survived and came to my house. The curse of judgment took away the rest, leaving the poor behind.<page>Is this shit an idea to let them go, or is it something completely different?
secondary_translated_text: 几位强大的朝圣者幸存下来，来到我家。审判的诅咒夺走了其余的人，留下了穷人。<page>这狗屎是让他们走的想法，还是完全不同的东西？

original_en_text: Bellhart, over the moors, a great town I’ve heard it once was, heart of the path’n all, right smack in the middle of these midlands.<page>Now it’s all a’crumble... And that brittle vein of bells is crawling with nasties. Ain’t no place left in Pharloom that can fairly claim to offer safety.
original_zh_text: 这片沼泽上方的钟心镇，当年可是个了不得的地方。位于整个中部地区的腹地，被称为朝圣之路的“心脏”。<page>如今全垮了……那儿的钟脉里爬满脏东西。纺络早没安全地界啦。
translated_text: I heard that Berhardt in the desert was once a big city, and its center was right among them.<page>The fragile veins of the clock, everything collapsed, covered with insects. There is no place for Pharaoh that I can claim to be safe.
secondary_translated_text: 听说沙漠中的伯哈特曾经是一座大城市，它的中心就在其中。<page>时钟脆弱的血管，一切都倒塌了，布满了昆虫。法老没有一个地方可以说是安全的。

original_en_text: You visited them pens up above here, miss? Horrid place, once all about growing meat or some such. Meant to keep us moorbugs livin’, and working, its told...<page>That damned place’s long gone to the Haunting. And now the meat’s running feral and free.
original_zh_text: 小姐，去过上头那个养殖场没？可怕的地方。早先是搞正经蟑螂肉养殖的——为了喂饱我们这些沼泽虫，好让我们认真工作……<page>那鬼地方早被丝咒侵占了。现在，养的蟑螂全都跑出来撒野。
translated_text: Do you see any closures upstairs? What I fear most is meat. Animals in wetlands learn to survive and work.<page>This hell has disappeared from the place where it haunted, and life is free and barbaric.
secondary_translated_text: 你看到楼上有关闭吗？我最害怕的是肉。湿地中的动物学会生存和工作。<page>这个地狱已经从它出没的地方消失了，生活自由而野蛮。

original_en_text: Welcome back, traveller. How’d you get along with collecting the Ragpelt from those mangy crawbugs? Their squawking and crooing up there is starting to wear mightily on my patrons!
original_zh_text: 旅行者，你回来啦？破毛皮收集得怎么样？屋顶上叽叽喳喳吵个没完，我的老顾客们都要跑光了！
translated_text: Welcome back, travel friends! What does it mean to collect pebbles from a dirty crab? Their screams and sighs began to have a strong impact on our customers!
secondary_translated_text: 欢迎回来，旅行朋友们!从一只脏螃蟹身上收集鹅卵石是什么意思？他们的尖叫声和叹息声开始对我们的顾客产生强烈的影响!

translated_text: Do you want to buy alcohol?

original_en_text: Hmm, holding on to them, eh? I won’t ask why, but I’d sure appreciate it if you reconsider.
original_zh_text: 嗯……不打算交给我？虽然不知道原因，但求您发发善心，再考虑考虑。
translated_text: I don't know why, but I want you to reconsider.
secondary_translated_text: 我不知道为什么，但我希望你能重新考虑。

original_en_text: Planning to grab that Vintage Nectar? You passed a fair bundle of rosaries for the bottle, so I figured you’ll be eager to see it yours.<page>The old stuff’s down there, at the bottom of the cellar. I’ll keep the trap open for you, just be swift.
original_zh_text: 准备去取陈年蜜露了吗？您可为它付了不少念珠，我想您肯定也急着将它收入囊中。<page>陈酿在地窖的底层，地窖门给您开着，麻烦您手脚麻利点。
translated_text: Do you want to drink this honey? I was dressed in Rosalie Hill, and I wanted to see if the bottle would be good, so I was going to buy one.<page>My grandfather is in the basement. We open the trap and leave immediately.“
secondary_translated_text: 你想喝这个蜂蜜吗？我穿着罗莎莉山（Rosalie Hill）的衣服，我想看看这瓶酒是否好，所以我打算买一瓶。<page>我的祖父在地下室。我们打开陷阱立即离开。“

original_en_text: Harh! Well met, traveller. Lookin’ for a drink, or a rest, or both?<hpage>Fair greetings, good bug. The warmth of your hearth is welcome upon these wet plains.<page>Aye. It’s a damp climb through these parts. Used to be just pilgrims trekkin’ my way, but odd times these are, and you ain’t even the strangest shell wandering about.<page>A rowdy old warrior stopped through not long back, caused quite a scene, and now a young lass’s taken up lodging in my top room.<page>The lass mentioned she’s on the lookout for sharp types like yourself. Maybe pay her a visit, if you haven’t already?
original_zh_text: 哈！贵客临门。想来盏蜜露，还是歇个脚，或者两样都要？<hpage>这地方真是不错。这湿漉漉的平原上，最缺你这里暖烘烘的炉火。<page>是啊，这地界爬上来可不容易。早先只有朝圣者路过，如今世道古怪，连您这副稀罕甲壳都到处晃悠。<page>前阵子有个老战士在我这儿闹腾得欢，这几天顶层客房又住进个小姑娘。<page>那姑娘正想找您这样的利落角色，有空不妨上楼瞧瞧？
translated_text: Oh! Oh! Good morning, traveler, drink, drink or both.<hpage>You are a good insect. The warmth of the fireplace is welcome in this humid plain.<page>In this area, it was a slippery climb. I used to be a pilgrim on my road, but oddly enough, now it is no longer the strangest shell.<page>Not long ago, a noisy veteran stopped to cause a disturbance, and now a little girl sleeps in my upstairs room.<page>She said she was always looking for someone as sensitive as her. If I haven't read it yet, can I read it?
secondary_translated_text: 哦!哦!早上好，旅行者，喝一杯，喝一杯，或者两者兼而有之。<hpage>你是一只好昆虫。壁炉的温暖在这片潮湿的平原上很受欢迎。<page>在这个地区，攀登过程很滑。我曾经是路上的朝圣者，但奇怪的是，现在它不再是最奇怪的贝壳了。<page>不久前，一位吵闹的退伍军人停下来闹事，现在一个小女孩睡在我楼上的房间里。<page>她说她一直在寻找像她这样敏感的人。如果我还没有读过，我可以读吗？

original_en_text: Excellent, excellent! Let’s give those mangy craws the fright of their lives! Hah!<page>All I need is some Ragpelt from the crawbugs themselves. Hunt ‘em down, collect their pelts, and bring me back a heap of the stuff. I’ll do the rest!
original_zh_text: 好极了！让那群臭腐囊虫见识见识，什么叫吓破胆！哈！<page>我需要腐囊虫身上的破毛皮作为材料。劳烦您宰些腐囊虫，取一些它们的破毛皮来。剩下的交给我！
translated_text: Well done! Well done! Well done! Well done! Well done! Well done! "Give a person with a malignant tumor a terrible life! "Oh, Oh.<page>I need my lobster, I will find it, collect its skin, bring a bag, and say,"I will make the rest!"”"
secondary_translated_text: 干得好！干得好！干得好！干得好！干得好！干得好！“给一个恶性肿瘤的人一个可怕的生活！“哦，哦。<page>我需要我的龙虾，我会找到它，收集它的皮，带一个袋子，说，“我会做剩下的！"”"

original_en_text: The sooner you’ve collected that Ragpelt, the better. I can’t have those pests killing more potential guests.<page>Business is slow enough already, and clearing corpses ain’t no fun at all.
original_zh_text: 赶紧把破毛皮弄来吧，越快越好。不能再让它们杀害我的潜在客户们了。<page>本来生意就不算好，收拾虫尸还费劲！
translated_text: The faster you collect garbage, the better. These parasites don't kill potential hosts, but they don't kill them.<page>It's too late now and it's not fun to get rid of your body.
secondary_translated_text: 垃圾收集得越快越好。这些寄生虫不会杀死潜在的宿主，但也不会杀死它们。<page>现在太晚了，摆脱你的身体并不有趣。

original_en_text: Wantin’ for a drink, traveller? Might soon be the end for all’o us, so no need to go easy on the nectar.
original_zh_text: 旅行者，要来喝一盏吗？反正大伙都快完蛋了，今朝有蜜今朝醉噢。
translated_text: Would you like something to drink, my friend? We don't need to rest too much in honey, because our end may come soon.
secondary_translated_text: 朋友，你想喝点什么吗？我们不需要在蜂蜜中休息太多，因为我们的末日可能很快就会到来。

original_en_text: <hpage>Barkeep, I have seen your request on the bell town’s wishwall. What assistance are you seeking?<page>Ah! Perfect! You’re the able sort that’ll make short work of the task.<page>The problem is those blasted craws atop here. My roof is fast becoming their cosy nest! Now they’ve grown so bold they’re starting to attack pilgrims as they pass.<hpage>Would you simply have me slay them? Your sturdy shell seems more than up to that task.<page>If only it were so simple. Kill the ones above and more just keep coming. It’s the warmth of this home you see. Draws ‘em right in.<page>I’m looking for a long-term solution. A scarecraw! I’ll build the biggest there’s ever been, so fearsome it’ll keep those craws away for good!<page>All I need is some Ragpelt from the crawbugs themselves. Hunt ‘em down, collect their pelts, and bring me back a heap of the stuff. I’ll do the rest!
original_zh_text: <hpage>酒保先生，我看见钟心镇祈愿墙上有你的委托。所为何事？<page>啊！太好了！可算找着行家了！<page>您看到房顶上那群腐囊虫了吗？它们快把我这儿当成自己的窝了！最近胆子越来越肥，已经开始攻击过路的朝圣者了。<hpage>你是想直接把它们杀光？看你这身强健的甲壳，办这事应该不费劲吧？<page>要这么简单就好了。杀完一茬又来一茬，全怪我这酒馆太暖和，招虫子。<page>得想个一劳永逸的办法——扎个巨型稻草人！保准吓得它们再不敢靠近！<page>我需要腐囊虫身上的破毛皮作为材料。劳烦您宰些腐囊虫，取一些它们的破毛皮来。剩下的交给我！
translated_text: <hpage>Bartender, I saw something ordered on the wall of Desire in Bell Town. What kind of help do you need?<page>Yes, right. Oh, yes! Ideal! You are the kind of person who works fast.<page>The problem is we have a crab. My roof will be your refuge. They grew brave and began attacking passing pilgrims.<hpage>Will you allow me to kill you? Its sturdy shell seems to be working well.<page>I wish it were that simple. If you kill more than one, you will get more. Look how hot the house is! You have direct attraction.<page>We are looking for a long-term solution. I know I've tried my best, it's so scary, you can stay away from crabs forever!<page>I need my lobster, I will find it, collect its skin, bring a bag, and say,"I will make the rest!"”"
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>调酒师，我在贝尔镇的欲望墙上看到了一些订购的东西。您需要什么样的帮助？<page>是的，正确的。哦，是的！理想！你是那种工作速度快的人。<page>问题是我们有一只螃蟹。我的屋顶将成为你的避难所。他们变得勇敢起来，开始袭击路过的朝圣者。<hpage>你会允许我杀了你吗？它坚固的外壳似乎工作得很好。<page>我希望事情就这么简单。如果你杀了不止一个，你就会得到更多。看看房子有多热！你有直接的吸引力。<page>我们正在寻找长期解决方案。我知道我已经尽力了，太可怕了，你可以永远远离螃蟹了！<page>我需要我的龙虾，我会找到它，收集它的皮，带一个袋子，说，“我会做剩下的！"”"

translated_text: Sky Light (Blue)

original_en_text: The Citadel is calling us, sister! We stand so close. We need only the blessing of those bells to see the Grand Gate open.<hpage>I will awaken the bells, pilgrim. With luck, you will not be waiting long.
original_zh_text: 圣堡在召唤，姊妹！我们只有一步之遥了。只需群钟赐福，巨扉圣门定将开启。<hpage>我会敲响那些巨钟。幸运的话，你们无需久候。
translated_text: "Sister, the castle is calling you! We need the blessing of a servant because we are too close to the door.<hpage>"Dear, I want to wake up the bell. If you're lucky, you won't have to wait too long.
secondary_translated_text: “姐姐，城堡在召唤你！我们需要仆人的祝福，因为我们离门太近了。<hpage>“亲爱的，我想叫醒钟声。如果您幸运的话，您不必等待太久。

original_en_text: Only the holy bells of the great path shall open the way!<page>We beg you, traveller, see the bells awoken, that we may cross this final threshold.
original_zh_text: 只有朝圣途中的圣钟可开启此门！<page>恳求您，旅行者。令众钟苏醒，我们方可越过这最终的门槛。
translated_text: Only sacred street corners can open the way.<page>Oh traveler, you may cross the last threshold. "
secondary_translated_text: 只有神圣的街角才能开辟道路。<page>哦，旅行者，你可能会跨过最后的门槛。"

original_en_text: Ahhh... the gate! The bells have awoken! All along the path. Now we need only music to see them attuned! <hpage>I have recently learnt the art of producing song by strumming Silk, though I confess it is a skill deserving of more practice.<page>Oh! Ohh! Have no doubt, sister! Play sincerely. Any music is sweet enough! Play for us, and surely the bells will resound! Play, and we will sing!
original_zh_text: 啊……巨门！圣钟皆已苏醒！眼下我们只需奏响音乐，使其共鸣！<hpage>我最近习得以灵丝拨弦成曲的技艺，但仍有些生疏。<page>噢！无需顾虑，姊妹！至诚则灵，凡乐皆美！为我们奏响音乐，圣钟必将回应！演奏吧，我们将为你歌唱！
translated_text: Yes, right. The door! The bell rings! "In the process, you can see the harmony in the music! "<hpage>I recently learned to touch silk and compose music, but I think it takes some practice.<page>Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Yes, yes, but the music is so sweet. Let's play together and ring the bell! Let's sing and play together!
secondary_translated_text: 是的，正确的。门！钟声响了！“在这个过程中，你可以看到音乐中的和谐！"<hpage>我最近学会了触摸丝绸和作曲，但我认为这需要一些练习。<page>哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！是的，是的，但是音乐太甜了。让我们一起玩，敲钟吧！让我们一起唱歌玩耍吧！

original_zh_text: 啊……巨扉圣门！圣钟皆已苏醒！<page>恳求您，姊妹。奏乐咏唱，我们定将跟随你。呼唤圣途钟声，开启此门！
translated_text: Yes, right. The door! The bell rings!“<page>"Please, sisters, play, drink, and continue. I rang the doorbell and saw the door open.
secondary_translated_text: 是的，正确的。门！钟声响了！“<page>“姐妹们，拜托，玩吧，喝吧，继续。我按响门铃，看到门开了。

original_en_text: We beg you, sister. Delay no further! Play for us. Call out to the bells of the path and see the Grand Gate open!
