secondary_translated_text: 朝圣者，无论活着还是死去，都必须互相照顾。

original_en_text: You stay, ssppidderrr? My brood needsss meat, much.. the organsss of othersss, or would you instead offer your own?<page>Gift a sshhell’s warm insidess as sweet feast for my brood’sss birth-meal?
original_zh_text: 还在呢，小蜘蛛……？咝——我的孩子需要血肉，很多血肉……我需要其他虫子的内脏，或者你献上你自己的？<page>咝——要不把你热乎的内脏当作我孩子们的破卵宴？
translated_text: "Why aren't you here, Spedler? "Children need meat, they need meat, and other people's organs are yours. "<page>Do you want to give your child a hot meal like a sweet cake?
secondary_translated_text: ”你为什么不来，Spedler吗？“孩子们需要肉，他们需要肉，别人的器官就是你的。"<page>你想给你的孩子一个像甜蛋糕热餐吗？

original_en_text: You have them, sspiiddderrr! The smell is upon you, all those organs, rich prepared for feasssting.
original_zh_text: 咝——！你做到了，小蜘蛛！瞧你满身的腥气。这么多内脏，足够给我的孩子开荤了。
translated_text: "There you are, spider. "The smell is inside you, and all your organs are preparing to celebrate. "
secondary_translated_text: “你在这里，蜘蛛。“气味就在你体内，你所有的器官都在准备庆祝。"

original_en_text: Come to rest your weary body? The climb is agonising, and even the devout must mind their limits.<hpage>I’m impressed to find any without firm claw upon a weapon that could ascend so far.<page>Indeed. We’re lucky to have made it here. Luckier than many others. Or perhaps the difference between the lucky and unlucky is merely faith?<page>Now, while we rest, shall we make trade? If you have rosaries, I’ll take them gladly.
original_zh_text: 是来歇息的么？攀登苦不堪言，再虔诚也要量力而行。<hpage>你赤手空拳能攀登至此，倒是少见。<page>是啊，能到此地实属侥幸，比许多同袍要幸运。或许所谓运气不过是信念之差？<page>既然在这休息，可要做买卖？你有念珠的话，我很乐意交换。
translated_text: Mountain climbing is painful, and even those with obligations are aware of its limitations.<hpage>Surprisingly, a powerful pistol without a hook can go this far.<page>Of course, I'm lucky to be here. You are luckier than others. What is the difference between a happy person and an unhappy person?<page>But in the time left, can we reach an agreement? If you have a rose, I would love to receive it.
secondary_translated_text: 登山是痛苦的，即使是那些有义务的人也意识到它的局限性。<hpage>令人惊讶的是，一把没有挂钩的威力强大的手枪可以走这么远。<page>当然，我很幸运能来到这里。你比别人幸运。快乐的人和不快乐的人有什么区别？<page>但在剩下的时间里，我们能达成协议吗？如果你有一朵玫瑰，我很乐意收到它。

original_en_text: Hunter... stayss... Shining claw... still... Does themsss help... seek?<page>Usss need meatsss, much, too... Hunter... Usss wants many... Seared... Skewered... Shredded...<page>Usss’s wantss grow sssstrong... much... Be like siblingsss, sharp, hard.
original_zh_text: 咝——猎手……你还在这儿……闪亮的爪子……我需要……帮助……<page>咝——我需要血肉，很多血肉……猎手……我要很多……烤的……串的……撕碎的……<page>咝——我要变壮……要像其他兄弟姐妹那样……壳硬爪利……
translated_text: Hunter Stad's "Glitter Feet" has not yet been released. Did you check it?<page>I want meat too, and hunters want lots of kebabs.<page>Oz's desire is as strong as his brothers, and growing stronger.
secondary_translated_text: 亨特·斯塔德的《闪光脚》尚未上映。你检查过了吗？<page>我也想要肉，猎人想要很多烤肉串。<page>奥兹的愿望和他的兄弟们一样强烈，而且越来越强烈。

original_en_text: Well, aren’t you a sight! No, don’t tell me! You’re as odd as they come.<page>Your poise! Your form! Are you hunted? Pursued? The Citadel would see a fine prize in you.<hpage>It is as you say, madam. Veiled bugs brought me to your land. I seek them now, for answers.<page>Ha! Fierce too! These are bleak times, but a powerful stray like you could certainly cause some change.<page>Well then! I’ve no love for that holy caste, and I do worry for this kingdom’s ailing state. If you’re seeking to settle a score, perhaps I can lend some aid?
original_zh_text: 瞧瞧这模样！让我猜猜，你不是这里的虫吧？<page>这仪态！这身姿！你正被追杀？被通缉？圣堡肯定很重视你。<hpage>如你所言，女士。覆面虫将我带来此地，我正在寻找它们。<page>哈！还挺凶！现在外面乱得很，你这般强悍的浪客肯定能搅出点动静。<page>正好！我也讨厌那群圣徒，也忧心王国的灾祸。你要找他们算账的话，或许我能帮衬？
translated_text: "You are not a visionary. No, no, no! Don't tell me that! The strange thing is what they did.<page>Her behavior! Official! Are you persecuted? Are you chasing him? The castle will treat you as a treasure.<hpage>As you said, madam, the insects in the tent brought me to your country.<page>Oh! Oh! He was forced! These days, it's a hole, but a powerful bodyguard like you will definitely change that.<page>I'm okay, I'm okay! Okay, okay! Okay! I dislike this sacred class, and I fear for the terrible conditions of the kingdom. If I need a spot, can you help me?
secondary_translated_text: “你不是有远见的人。不，不，不！别告诉我这个！奇怪的是他们所做的事情。<page>她的行为！官方！你受到迫害吗？你在追他吗？城堡会把你当成宝藏。<hpage>正如您所说，夫人，帐篷里的昆虫把我带到了您的国家。<page>哦！哦！他是被迫的！如今，这是一个洞，但像你这样强大的保镖肯定会改变这一点。<page>我没事，我没事！好吧，好吧！好的！我不喜欢这个神圣的阶级，我担心王国的可怕状况。如果我需要一个名额，你能帮助我吗？

original_en_text: Hunter... Shining claw... Do not killsss... Mine is ssshell thin. Taste is poor...<page>Me’sss born not like siblingsss, themsss large and hard... All themsss did feasted and flew.<hpage>I see it clear, child. The tall mother’s meat has fed the brood fresh hatched.<hpage>It was a common fate that found her. Too common, perhaps...<page>Gone... the mother, her meatsss... and lifesss... for siblingss strong... not for usss so small... Neverss for usss...
original_zh_text: 猎手……闪亮的爪子……别杀我……咝……我的壳薄……肉柴……<page>我生来不像其他兄弟姐妹……咝——他们甲壳又大又硬……吃饱就飞走了。<hpage>看出来了，小不点。你母亲把自己的肉喂给了其他刚破卵的孩子。<hpage>她命该如此。或许……这就是她的宿命……<page>没了……母亲，她的血肉……和生命……养壮了兄弟姐妹……咝……没我的份……永远没有……
translated_text: Don't tell me you're losing weight, it's terrible.<page>I was born like a brother. They are great and powerful. We all had a good time and left.<hpage>My mother's meat was donated to freshly released chickens.<hpage>Finding it will be our common destiny.<page>Mom, I want to go out, meat! Life has never been ours.
secondary_translated_text: 别告诉我你减肥了，太可怕了。<page>我生来就像兄弟一样。他们伟大而强大。我们都玩得很开心就离开了。<hpage>我母亲的肉捐赠给了新鲜释放的鸡。<hpage>找到它将是我们共同的命运。<page>妈妈，我要出去，肉！生活从来都不是我们的。

original_en_text: Pale beast... bringing ruin... we had sensed it... you writing harsh our final fate...<page>If power... you come seeking... mine is faded.... mortal... time taken...<hpage>Great one, I come not to see you as you are, rather I would have you recall what you were, before the pale monarch, when once your heart beat bright and brave.<hpage>That beating heart I would take, though know my intent is worthy.<hpage>I seek it only to save these lands, to break them free from this fatal sickness born of thread and void.<page>Kcha! If you may... beast... If you can... Mine once was power... wild... proud...
original_zh_text: 苍白异兽……携灾而至……吾等早有预感……汝书写的，是斯卡尔的终章……<page>若力量……是汝所求……吾已衰微……凡躯……时日无多……<hpage>蚁后，我来此并非为了觐见，而是追忆您昔年的英姿。在苍白君主降临前，当您的英勇之心仍炽烈搏动之时。<hpage>我欲取得那份搏动之心，还请您相信我的初衷磊落。<hpage>只为拯救这片土地，斩断丝咒与虚空的腐毒。<page>喀嚓！……若汝能……异兽……若汝可……吾曾执掌……狂野……伟力……傲然……
translated_text: We feel the cruelty of his work and our ultimate destiny.<page>If you have the power, come and take her away. My power has disappeared and people usually need more time.<hpage>"I'm not here to see what kind of person you are, I'm here to remind you what kind of person you are in front of the emperor.<hpage>"I want to get rid of this heartbeat, but I think my intentions are worth it.<hpage>I worked hard to save this planet from the deadly disease of wires and vacuum.<page>Here is it! If possible, the animals are proud of nature.
secondary_translated_text: 我们感受到了他工作的残酷性和我们最终的命运。<page>如果你有能力，就来把她带走。我的力量消失了，人们通常需要更多时间。<hpage>“我来这里不是为了看看你是什么样的人，而是为了在皇帝面前提醒你你是什么样的人。<hpage>“我想摆脱这种心跳，但我认为我的意图是值得的。<hpage>我努力工作，拯救这个星球免受电线和真空致命疾病的侵害。<page>就是这里！如果可能的话，动物们为大自然感到自豪。

original_en_text: <hpage>Your land’s fate has turned too dire, child. I cannot delay now to help you in your growth.<page>Sssss... So huntersss live... kill... only for selvesss... same as siblings...
original_zh_text: <hpage>你们的这片土地危在旦夕，小不点。时间紧迫，我没法帮你长壮实了。<page>咝……猎手为了生存……而杀戮……只顾自己……和离我而去兄弟姐妹没什么两样……
translated_text: <hpage>My child, the fate of your planet is deteriorating. We can't wait any longer.<page>The sound of collision. The hunter died instantly. Only portraits of brothers and sisters are allowed.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>我的孩子，你们星球的命运正在恶化。我们不能再等了。<page>碰撞的声音。猎人当场死亡。只允许拍摄兄弟姐妹的肖像。

original_en_text: These fields are hot and harsh, a miserable place for we pilgrims, and just above are the dreary moors, a place once of abundance lost to falling silt and murky rain.<page>The lands in every direction punish us, but such is our test. Above it all, the Citadel shines, our destination and our reward...<page>I’ll make it there, you’ll see. I’ve easily earned my place in such a paradise.
original_zh_text: <page>再往上，是一片阴雨连绵的沼地，过去的丰饶都化作了泥泞。<page>凶险又容易迷失，是对朝圣者的试炼。而圣堡就在上方，既是终点亦是奖赏……<page>我肯定能抵达，等着瞧。入那乐园我当之无愧。
translated_text: The fields are hot and desolate, an unfortunate place for pilgrims, and above it is a desolate desert where the lime and rainwater soil have lost its fertile soil.<page>All countries are punishing us, but this is a test for us.<page>"I will go, you will see, it's easy to find a place in this paradise.
secondary_translated_text: 田野炎热荒凉，对于朝圣者来说是一个不幸的地方，上面是一片荒凉的沙漠，石灰和雨水土壤已经失去了肥沃的土壤。<page>所有国家都在惩罚我们，但这是对我们的考验。<page>“我要去，你会看到，在这个天堂里很容易找到一个地方。

original_en_text: <hpage>Is this place your permanent home, sir, or do you only make camp?<page>We pilgrims have no home, there is only the path. We climb, and suffer, and are thusly judged.<page>I will linger here only a moment, for the sake of trade. Once I’ve gathered enough rosaries, I’ll be holy enough to ascend without fear.
original_zh_text: <hpage>先生可是以此地为家，还是暂驻？<page>朝圣者居无定所，唯有攀登圣途。前路如何，谁能晓得。<page>我小憩片刻就会启程。等攒够念珠，自能无畏登顶。
translated_text: <hpage>Is this your eternal home? Or was he just camping?<page>Pilgrims have no homes, they have streets; we speak, we suffer, we judge.<page>When you eat enough rosary, you will become holy enough to rise without fear.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>这是你永恒的家吗？或者他只是露营？<page>朝圣者没有家，他们有街道;我们说话，我们受苦，我们审判。<page>当你吃足够的念珠时，你就会变得足够神圣，可以毫无恐惧地崛起。

original_en_text: <hpage>On the far side of Pharloom, I chanced upon a bug starkly similar to yourself.<hpage>From her home, her dress, and her skill, I am guessing you share some relation?<page>Aye. Met my sister, you did, in order at least. Glad to hear she’s still among the living.<page>Last to hold true to the old ways of the pin, she was... I sure ain’t sharing many of those violent values no more.<page>I’ll warn you, stray one, my sister might seem all cheer and charm, but buried beneath there’s the soul of a killer.
original_zh_text: <hpage>我在纺络另一端遇见过与你极为相似的虫。<hpage>根据其居所、衣着和技艺，也许是你血亲？<page>是，那是我的姐妹。她还活着呢？也挺好。<page>她是最后恪守古训的针匠……我早就不玩那套杀戮把戏了。<page>提醒你，我那姐妹看着亲切，骨子里可是杀胚。
translated_text: <hpage>On the other side of the lighthouse, I found an insect like you.<hpage>Judging from your house, your clothes and your abilities, what do you think this has to do with this?<page>Yes, they saw my sister, at least in good conditions.<page>You are the last person under pressure. "<page>My sister may seem happy and alluring, but she has the soul of a killer.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>在灯塔的另一边，我发现了一只像你一样的昆虫。<hpage>从你的房子、你的衣服、你的能力来看，你认为这和这个有什么关系？<page>是的，他们看到了我妹妹，至少情况良好。<page>你是最后一个承受压力的人。"<page>我姐姐可能看起来快乐而迷人，但她有着杀手的灵魂。

original_en_text: You would deny my brood their strength, ssspiidderr? A cruel creature you are. Surely your sssmall shell needs hardly so much?
original_zh_text: 你准备饿着我的孩子吗，小蜘蛛？咝——心肠够硬啊。不过，你这小身板能独吞这么多？
translated_text: Will our children be disempowered? You are a cruel creature. Do you need an SSsmall silk?
secondary_translated_text: 我们的孩子会被剥夺权力吗？你是一个残酷的生物。你需要SS small丝绸吗？

original_en_text: I’ll string your rosaries tight, for a modest fee. It’s the safest way to keep them close.
original_zh_text: 分我一些念珠，我帮你把它们串牢。贴身保管最稳妥。
translated_text: "I fully support your roses.

original_en_text: Uoohhh... Sister, my aching shell’s close to breaking. My voice weakens... I can hardly sing a word.<hpage>I fear the path ahead will be no easier for you, ma’am. If you can not abandon your pilgrimage, you should at least rest well before continuing.<page>Ahh... but impurities stalk our every step, sister. If we rest too long, they shall catch us. So... so it is sung...
original_zh_text: 啊……姐妹，我的甲壳快撑不住了……嗓子也哑……唱不动圣歌了……<hpage>前路只会更加凶险，女士。若不愿放弃朝圣，至少养足精神再走。<page>唉……可邪秽如影随形，歇久了必被追上……圣训……是这么唱的……
translated_text: Yes, right. My sick body was about to explode, my voice was weak, and I could hardly sing.<hpage>Unfortunately, the road ahead is not easy, and if you can't give up the pilgrimage, at least it's worth a break.<page>Yes, right. Accompany me every step of the way, sister! If you rest too long, you will catch it and I will sing.
secondary_translated_text: 是的，正确的。我生病的身体快要爆炸了，声音微弱，几乎无法唱歌。<hpage>不幸的是，前面的路并不容易，如果不能放弃朝圣之旅，至少值得休息一下。<page>是的，正确的。陪我走每一步，姐姐！如果你休息太久，你就会接住它，我就会唱歌。

original_en_text: That golden knight’s out there, sister, cutting down the lost, keeping us safe.<page>Reckon this place would’ve already been overrun if not for them’n their noble blades.
original_zh_text: 小姐，那位金甲骑士在外面斩杀着被诅咒者，保护我们的安全。<page>没有他那伟大的刺刃，这地方早就败落了。
translated_text: Sister, the Golden Knight is here to destroy the lost and protect us. "<page>If it weren't for flattery, this place would have been busy.
secondary_translated_text: 姐姐，黄金骑士来这里是为了摧毁迷失的人并保护我们。"<page>如果不是奉承，这里早就热闹了。

original_en_text: Take some beads for your effort, miss bellringer, and know this sad lot’ll be survivin’ a little longer thanks to you.
original_zh_text: 敲钟者小姐，拿些念珠当作辛苦费吧。多亏你，这些可怜虫又能多苟活几天了。
translated_text: "Mrs. Belinger, the pearl of your efforts. "Thank you, this tragic fate will last for some time.
secondary_translated_text: “贝林格夫人，你努力的明珠。“谢谢，这种悲惨的命运将持续一段时间。

original_en_text: S’done! The parts are prepared. I’m headin’ up now to set the heavy thing.<page>Even with the trap laid, best be guessin’ her on top won’t go down so simple. She’ll sense what’s comin’.<page>That blade of yours is gonna have to do its work ‘fore this thing can snap.<hpage>I’d expected such, sir. And I am ready. Set your snare. I shall attend shortly.
original_zh_text: 搞定了！部件准备完毕。我这就上去布置。<page>就算陷阱就位，顶上那位也不会乖乖受死。她能预感到潜在的危机。<page>你得先用你的针刃削弱她，这玩意才能触发。<hpage>我早有预料，先生。我已准备就绪。布置陷阱吧，我随后就到。
translated_text: "It's over, I'm ready, I'm fat.<page>Even if a trap is set, it's best to assume that it won't fall easily.<page>Before it can be broken, the blade must work.<hpage>I thought he was ready to set a trap for you, so I joined you immediately.
secondary_translated_text: “结束了，我准备好了，我胖了。<page>即使设置了陷阱，最好假设它不会轻易掉下来。<page>在它被折断之前，刀片必须工作。<hpage>我以为他已经准备好给你设下陷阱了，所以我立即加入了你。

original_en_text: Everything is falling apart, my dear one. Be sure to share your rosaries with me before it’s too late!
original_zh_text: 亲爱的，这里的一切都在分崩离析。趁现在还来得及，把你的念珠分我一些吧！
translated_text: Please share my prayers before it's too late!
secondary_translated_text: 请在为时已晚之前分享我的祈祷！

original_en_text: Lots of stories being sung about you, dear one. Gathering supplies, saving lost bugs... all sorts of good deeds!<page>Very clever to craft such a reputation for yourself. If you keep it up, you’ll fast become a legend among these simple sorts.<hpage>I’ve no interest in becoming one, madam. In my long life, I’ve known enough legends, watched them rise and fall and fade away, many times.<page>Is that so, dear? How humble you are! You should know though, this old pilgrim has her sight keenly trained on you! Nothing gets by old Jubilana!
original_zh_text: 亲爱的，现在好多虫子都在传颂你的事迹呢。收集物资、拯救迷失的虫子……全是各种各样的善举！<page>你很聪明，给自己打造了这么好的名声。这样下去，你很快就会成为这些单纯的家伙们心中的传奇啦。<hpage>女士，我可没兴趣成为什么传奇。在漫长的一生中，我见识过足够多的传奇，无数次看着他们崛起、衰落、消逝。<page>这样啊？亲爱的，你可真谦逊！不过你要知道，我这个老朝圣者可一直密切关注着你呢！什么都逃不过老朱比拉娜的眼睛！
translated_text: You will have many stories. Collect consumables and save lost insects. Everything is beautiful while moving!<page>If you stick with it, you will soon become a legend for this simple character.<hpage>For a long time in my life, I studied legends carefully and watched them rise and fall again and again.<page>Isn't it, honey? How humble! But make sure the pilgrim's eyes are comfortably watching you.
secondary_translated_text: 你会有很多故事。收集消耗品并拯救丢失的昆虫。移动时一切都很美丽！<page>如果你坚持下去，你很快就会成为这个简单角色的传奇。<hpage>在我一生中的很长一段时间里，我仔细研究传说，看着它们一次又一次的兴衰。<page>不是吗，亲爱的？多么谦虚啊！但要确保朝圣者的眼睛舒适地看着你。

original_en_text: It was you, wasn’t it? Ringin’ that great clanging bell just now! Right when I’m tryin’ to get some sleep!
original_zh_text: 刚才敲钟的是你吧？叮呤咣啷的！我正要补觉呢！
translated_text: Are you really? There is a lot of noise! When I try to sleep!
secondary_translated_text: 你真的是吗？噪音很大！当我试图睡觉的时候！

original_en_text: Please don’t go too far, sister. Right here’s the only safety you’ll find within this whole cursed place.
original_zh_text: 小姐，千万别走远。在这片诅咒之地，这儿是唯一安全的地方。
translated_text: This is the only safe place.

original_en_text: There must be a few more goodies to gather up here, and I don’t need you lingering around in the meantime. Blessings, and farewell!
original_zh_text: 我这会儿可没法跟你一块回去，路上可能还有好东西等着我捡漏呢。愿你蒙福，再见！
translated_text: There are some good things here, and we don't need to wander around this time. Blessings and goodbye!
secondary_translated_text: 这里有一些好东西，这次我们就不用到处闲逛了。祝福和再见！

original_en_text: Well, well! See here what your brash behaviour has wrought, bellringer!<page>Just as I predicted, this once-peaceful sanctuary is now crawling with all sorts. We’ve the beginnings of a shabby little settlement, all huddled around this old shrine!<hpage>These poor bugs, all are victims of the Citadel and its insidious attraction. This place draws them up, into its maw, only to consume them, utterly.<page>Aye, inside and out, s’nothing but a grand, gilded lie. Well, at least these few stragglers can enjoy a moment’s safety. Poor fools...
original_zh_text: 瞧瞧你干的好事，敲钟者！<page>跟我料想的一样，这座本来平静的钟殿现在挤满了各色杂碎！一帮可怜虫围着那旧钟搭了个窝！<hpage>这些可怜虫都是圣堡的牺牲品，被它的谎话骗来，最终将被吞噬殆尽。<page>哼哼，这里就是个外表光鲜的巨大骗局。不过至少这群蠢货能享受片刻安宁……
translated_text: "Look at your arrogance, Berlin.<page>Once a quiet refuge, it is now filled with all kinds of people. We created a small but strict colony that gathered everything around this ancient temple!<hpage>This poor insect has become a victim of sexual and subtle charms. This place will attract them, put them in your stomach and let them absorb completely.<page>Yes, it's just a golden lie. At the very least, those who stay can enjoy safe time. Poor fool! "
secondary_translated_text: “看看你的傲慢，柏林。<page>曾经是一个安静的避难所，现在挤满了各种各样的人。我们创建了一个小而严格的殖民地，将一切聚集在这座古老的寺庙周围！<hpage>这种可怜的昆虫已经成为性魅力和微妙魅力的受害者。这个地方会吸引它们，把它们放在你的胃里，让它们完全吸收。<page>是的，这只是一个金色的谎言。至少，留下来的人可以享受安全的时光。可怜的傻瓜！"

original_en_text: A precious order passed down by the holy conductors. Rare now to find these old texts, and rarer still to find a bug able to read ‘em.
original_zh_text: 神圣指挥官亲笔签发的珍稀敕令。如今，这种古卷已经很难找到了，而能读懂它们的虫子就更少见了。
translated_text: These ancient texts are hard to find, and discovering errors is harder than reading.
secondary_translated_text: 这些古老的文本很难找到，发现错误比阅读更难。

original_en_text: Ooh, what a turn-up! I’d feared t’was naught but meself left sane about these halls. Seems this old bug’s luck has not yet worn thin!<hpage>It was more than luck that saw me to you, madam. I promised the wish of bugs concerned for your safety.<hpage>I urge you to head their way now, beside the old bell, up and over.<hpage>A small settlement has formed there, and the bell, reawakened, seems to ward away the worst of the Citadel’s many dangers.<page>A settlement? In these long-haunted halls? Are you telling naughty little lies, dear one? Well, I suppose there’s not too much danger in going and seeing the truth for meself.
original_zh_text: 哎呀呀！还以为这鬼地方只剩我没发疯呢！看来我这只老婆子运气还没用完！<hpage>我能找到你可不只是运气使然，女士，我是受其他虫子所托来确保你的安全。请尽快前往上方那座古钟，同那些虫子会合。<hpage>那古钟周围形成了一个小型庇护所，重鸣的钟声似乎能驱散圣堡的大部分危险。<page>庇护所？在这闹鬼的圣堡？亲爱的，你在编故事吧？不过亲眼去看看也无妨~
translated_text: Oh, that's great! I thought it was great, but I focused on this room. Obviously, the possibility of this old mistake has not disappeared!<hpage>I agree with your wish and am concerned about Babs 'safety.<hpage>I suggest you walk in its direction and climb over the old clock.<hpage>A small colony was formed here, and the Bermen were recalled, and they seemed able to protect the castle from the most serious dangers.<page>Conciliation? Are you in this old house?" I don't think it's dangerous to see the truth.
secondary_translated_text: 哦，那太好了！我认为这很棒，但我专注于这个房间。显然，这个老错误的可能性并没有消失！<hpage>我同意你的愿望，并担心巴布斯的安全。<hpage>我建议你朝它的方向走，爬过旧时钟。<hpage>这里形成了一个小殖民地，伯曼人被召回，他们似乎能够保护城堡免受最严重的危险。<page>和解？你在这所老房子里吗？“我认为看到真相并不危险。

original_en_text: Be away then, dear one, and leave me to gather up my trinkets and baubles.<page>If this settlement of yours truly has bugs settled safe, I’ll be able to make some lucrative trades. Blessings and farewell!
original_zh_text: 快走吧，亲爱的。别耽误我收拾我的宝贝货物。<page>要是你那庇护所真能安生做生意，老婆子我定能大赚一笔！愿你蒙福，再见！
translated_text: "Okay, honey, let me take my little thing.<page>If your protocol resolves errors safely, I can engage in profitable business.
secondary_translated_text: “好吧，亲爱的，让我拿走我的小东西。<page>如果您的协议安全地解决错误，我就可以从事有利可图的业务。

original_en_text: It’s feelin’ almost time, eh, bellringer? You and her who waits up there. That fated meeting won’t hold forever... Ready to make your play, to oust one ruler and claim her place?<hpage>I’ll not deny some part of me desires that outcome... Dominance, it seems, is baked deep in my blood, as too, no doubt, for the one up top.<hpage>And yet, another part resists... A part, over time, I find myself siding with more...<hpage>That part wishes not to claim a monarch’s mantle, rather it would see my freedom regained, and this kingdom’s bugs unshackled from their pale chains.<page>...Remarkable idea you’re speakin’ there, bellringer, a world cut free. Not a wish I’ve had much cause to hope on, serious like... but I ain’t so surprised to hear you speak it.<page>For all your helpin’, I been seein’ it clearer. You’ve still got the monarch in you, alright, and the glare of a Weaver, but the ambition... that’s wild different from both.<hpage>If you have already guessed to my desire, sir, and share some part of it, would you offer me aid in the conflict to come?<page>Aye... Maybe, yes. I can barely bear to tell it... But there’s an idea, one rare discussed, for fear of her up there sensin’ the score.<hpage>You have conceived a method, I take it? A way to see a monarch... removed? And me left free from claiming her station?<page>...We have, me and what remains of my family. S’a trap, of a sort, beyond the skill of this Citadel, one to go further than just her binding. You’d be just the hunter to set it, if you’re dare enough to try...
original_zh_text: 时机快到了吧，敲钟者？你和顶上那位迟早要碰面……准备好推翻旧主，自己上位了吗？<hpage>一定程度上，我不否认自己渴求这样的结果……我的统治欲深植血脉，和顶上那位一样。<hpage>但另一部分的我在抗拒……而这一部分正变得愈发强烈……<hpage>不想戴上王冠，只盼重获自由，让这王国的虫民挣脱苍白的枷锁。<page>一个解脱束缚的世界……真是难以想象。我虽然不敢奢望，但从你嘴里说出来倒不意外。<page>看你四处救援，我也明白了。你确有君王的血统和织者的锋芒，但野心……和两者都截然不同。<hpage>先生，既然你已了解我的想法，可否在即将到来的纷乱中助我一臂之力？<page>啊……或许可以吧。我有一计……但这是一招险棋，鲜少被提及，唯恐被顶上那位察觉。<hpage>也就是说……你有能让我弑君并自由脱身的方法？<page>我们……我那残存的家族确实有个计划。那是一种陷阱，一种超越圣堡的陷阱。而你恰好能成为安放这个陷阱的猎手——如果你胆子够大的话……
translated_text: Time is getting closer, I believe. You and I are waiting for you. Destiny doesn't last forever, does it? Are you ready to embark on a plan to overthrow the ruler and seize the throne?<hpage>I cannot deny part of my hope for the outcome. Leadership seems to be deeply rooted in my blood, and I have no doubt that I will dominate at the highest level.<hpage>Some even resisted. "As time went on, I became more and more isolated.<hpage>They don't want to wear the clothes of a monarch, but they want me to be free and the insects of the kingdom freed from their pale shackles.<page>... "How free you are, Belinger, that's a good idea for a free world. I wouldn't be surprised if I told you.<page>"Thank you for your help, I know. I have talent in the textile industry, but I have ambitions.<hpage>If you can guess your wishes and share some of them, will that help resolve upcoming conflicts? "<page>Yes, maybe I am. I can't say it, but some ideas are rarely discussed because I'm afraid of hearing human voices.<hpage>Do you think we can find the monarch? Don't you think I can replace him?<page>... This is a trap that is beyond the capabilities of this castle and beyond its chains. If you have the courage to face challenges, you are a hunter.
secondary_translated_text: 我相信时间越来越近了。你和我都在等你。命运不会永远持续，不是吗？你准备好开始推翻统治者并夺取王位的计划了吗？<hpage>我不能否认我对结果的部分希望。领导力似乎深深植根于我的血液中，我毫不怀疑我将在最高层占据主导地位。<hpage>有些人甚至抵制。“随着时间的推移，我变得越来越孤立。<hpage>他们不想穿君主的衣服，但他们想让我自由，让王国的昆虫从他们苍白的枷锁中解放出来。<page>...“你是多么自由，贝林格，这是一个自由世界的好主意。如果我告诉你我也不会惊讶。<page>“谢谢你的帮助，我知道。我在纺织行业有天赋，但我有抱负。<hpage>如果您能猜出您的愿望并分享其中一些愿望，这有助于解决即将发生的冲突吗？"<page>是的，也许我是。我不能说，但有些想法很少被讨论，因为我害怕听到人声。<hpage>你认为我们能找到君主吗？你不认为我可以取代他吗？<page>...这是一个超出了这座城堡能力和锁链的陷阱。如果你有勇气面对挑战，你就是一名猎人。

original_en_text: What’s that you got there, bellringer? Stole someone else’s soul for yourself?<hpage>You speak of the remnant I found in the muck-choked caves beside the Citadel? This is soul siphoned from a once powerful bug.<hpage>It’s only a thin mix now, but there is still some strength left. At peak, their talents must have been impressive.<page>Aye, they was that. I knew the bug, in ‘is prime, long time back. Braver’n most, and as little a fan of this Citadel as you yourself.<page>Went seekin’ alliance with those basic bugs of the swamps. Thought they’d both gain from the union... Scheming defiance, or some such stupidity!<page>Now he’s as dead as he was daft! Don’t go tryin’ ta make friends in Pharloom, bellringer. Nothin’ good comes of it.
original_zh_text: 敲钟者，你手里攥着什么？偷了谁的灵魂？<hpage>你是说我在圣堡旁边泥沼洞穴里找到的灵魂？这是从一只强大的甲虫身上剥离出来的。<hpage>虽然稀薄但尚存力量，全盛时期定非等闲之辈。<page>啊，没错！我认识那虫子，当年也算条好汉，而且跟你一样厌恶圣堡。<page>居然想联合沼泽平民搞叛乱！以为能互利共赢……真是蠢到家的反抗计划！<page>现在死得渣都不剩！所以说，在纺络交朋友准没好下场！
translated_text: The bell rings, what are you doing? Steal other people's souls for yourself?<hpage>Did you mention the remains found in mud holes near the castle? Souls come from powerful insects.<hpage>We are a weak group, but we are still strong. His talent was impressive at its peak.<page>Oh, yeah, right. I think this mistake happened a long time ago, in the golden age, when the bravest people didn't like castles like you.<page>Alliances with these essential bacteria can be seen in humid areas, and each of us benefits from alliances.<page>Don't try to make friends with Lighthouse, Bellinger. There were no good results.
secondary_translated_text: 铃声响了，你在做什么？为自己窃取别人的灵魂？<hpage>你有没有提到在城堡附近的泥坑里发现的遗骸？灵魂来自强大的昆虫。<hpage>我们是一个弱势群体，但我们仍然很强大。他的才华在巅峰时期令人印象深刻。<page>哦，是的，对。我认为这个错误发生在很久以前，在黄金时代，当时最勇敢的人都不喜欢像你这样的城堡。<page>在潮湿地区可以看到与这些必需细菌的联盟，我们每个人都从联盟中受益。<page>别试图和灯塔交朋友，贝林格。没有什么好的结果。

original_en_text: Hmph. Bellringer, you might think me a dullard, but I understand this place and have well-good senses.<page>Brought here, weren’t you? From beyond the border of our lands?<hpage>You are correct. The one who waits atop this Citadel... Through their hospitality, I arrived in this kingdom. I seek now to return that welcome in kind.<page>Hmph. Beastly words, them. Finely spoken, but beastly all the same.<page>I just pray you don’t bring any more unneeded pain down on the heads of these gormless little pilgrims...
original_zh_text: 哼，敲钟者，别当我是蠢货。我对这地方算是知根知底，而且我的预感往往很灵验。<page>你是从纺络境外被“请”来的吧？<hpage>没错。圣堡顶端那位邀请我来到这个王国……盛情难却，现在轮到我回礼了。<page>冠冕堂皇的野兽做派！话说得再漂亮，骨子里还是透出兽性！<page>只希望你别再牵连这些呆头呆脑的朝圣者……
translated_text: - "Hey, Bollinger, you might think I'm an idiot, but I know this place and I feel good.<page>Did you bring me here? What are you doing? At my country's borders?<hpage>"You are right, people are waiting for you in the castle. Thanks to his hospitality, I entered the kingdom. You will also be welcomed.<page>He speaks like an animal and speaks well, but he is still wild.<page>I pray that those meaningless pilgrims will no longer suffer needlessly.
secondary_translated_text: - “嘿，博林格，你可能认为我是个白痴，但我了解这个地方，我感觉很好。<page>你带我来这里的吗？你在干什么？在我国边境？<hpage>“你说得对，人们正在城堡里等你。多亏了他的热情款待，我才得以进入王国。你也将受到欢迎。<page>他说话像动物一样，而且说得很好，但他仍然很狂野。<page>我祈祷那些毫无意义的朝圣者不再遭受不必要的痛苦。

original_en_text: Found it all, did ya, bellringer? Then join me and let’s get to preppin’! I’ll be askin’ both your Silk and your claws ‘fore the construction.
original_zh_text: 找齐了是吧？那就快来搭把手！我需要你的灵丝和利爪参与构建。
translated_text: You found everything, didn't you? Really? About Bellinger Let's cook together! Before building, we asked for silk and nails.
secondary_translated_text: 你找到了一切，不是吗？真的吗？关于Bellinger让我们一起做饭吧！在建造之前，我们要求了丝绸和钉子。

original_en_text: The Citadel chose us, granted us a little more living. For what purpose though, who could say?
original_zh_text: 圣堡选择了我们，赏我们多活两天。谁知道是出于什么目的呢？
translated_text: God chose us and gave us more life.
secondary_translated_text: 上帝选择了我们，给了我们更多的生命。

original_en_text: If’n your wantin’ that trap made, you’d best get to collectin’. I’ll point you toward what’s needed, best as I can.
original_zh_text: 如果决定要把那个陷阱造出来，就快去收集所需的部分。我会告诉你需要做什么。
translated_text: If you need this trap, grab it. I will do my best to tell you what you want.
secondary_translated_text: 如果你需要这个陷阱，就抓住它。我会尽我所能告诉你你想要什么。

original_en_text: Heard you did the savin’ for our dear merchant there? I’ve seen her about, sneaking and scrounging, even a’fore you was ringing that bell.<page>She’s a useful sort, but don’t let her age be foolin’, she’s still the sharpest mind for a deal.<page>Won’t be long till there’s nary a rosary about this shrine that ain’t found its way into her pockets.
original_zh_text: 听说你救了那个奸商？早在你敲钟之前，我就瞧见她在这儿鬼鬼祟祟扒拉破烂了。<page>别看她老，坑钱手段多着呢！<page>要不了多久，这附近的念珠全得进她腰包！
translated_text: I heard you had saved money for a valuable mercenary, and before knocking on the door, I saw you begging.<page>He is a useful person, but don't lie to him even if he is old.<page>After a while, the rosary beads from the temple were placed in my pocket.
secondary_translated_text: 听说你为一位身价不菲的雇佣兵攒钱，在敲门之前，我看到你在乞讨。<page>他是一个有用的人，但即使他老了也不要骗他。<page>过了一会儿，寺庙里的念珠就放进了我的口袋。

original_en_text: Bellringer... Re-thinkin’ on that trap, are ya? It’s a mad method, for sure, but you’d be just the hunter to set it, if’n you’re dare enough to try...
original_zh_text: 敲钟者……有重新考虑过陷阱的事吗？这想法虽然疯狂，但对你来说最合适不过了……如果你胆子够大的话。
translated_text: Who is ringing the bell? Will you rethink your trap? Sure, it's a crazy method, but if you have the courage to try it, you're a crazy hunter to install it.
secondary_translated_text: 谁在敲钟？你会重新考虑你的陷阱吗？当然，这是一个疯狂的方法，但如果你有勇气尝试它，你就是安装它的疯狂猎人。

original_en_text: <hpage>Grant me your aid, sir. If your trap provides a path to freedom, both for myself and your land’s bugs, I may indeed choose to trigger it.<hpage>What work do you require of me now to see your service made?<page>It’s my family’s strength you’ll need be seeking, bellringer, us three ol’ bugs still alive, spread ‘cross this kingdom, and one poor cousin dead and drained in swamps choked rotten.<page>Each has power. Raw, savage stuff! For you, they’ll give it, if for their fascination at the act, or the thrill of defiance... or because they have no choice at all.
original_zh_text: <hpage>请助我一臂之力，先生。若你的陷阱真能为这片土地的虫子和我带来自由，我愿成为那个安放它的猎手。<hpage>现在需要我做些什么？<page>去召集我家族的力量——三个苟活的老家伙，他们分散王国各处。还有个可怜的表弟，他死在了腐臭的沼泽。<page>我的家人每个都带着野蛮原始的力量！他们会把力量交给你——或是出于对你这种勇气的欣赏，或是享受反抗带来的的亢奋……抑或是别无选择。
translated_text: <hpage>If your trap gave me and the insects on your land a path to freedom, I would decide to provoke you.<hpage>What do you want to do to verify your service?<page>There are still three living insects in our kingdom, and a poor cousin drowned in the swamp.<page>Everyone has power! For you, barbarians, if they enter or experience rebellious emotions, they have no choice or choice over you.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>如果你的陷阱给了我和你土地上的昆虫一条自由之路，我会决定挑衅你。<hpage>您想做什么来验证您的服务？<page>我们的王国里还有三种活着的昆虫，还有一个可怜的表弟淹死在沼泽里。<page>每个人都有力量！对于你来说，野蛮人，如果他们进入或经历叛逆情绪，他们对你没有选择或选择。

original_en_text: Real fine key this. No doubt it’ll open the way to somewhere special. Somewhere full of goodies, I’ll bet. Find the lock, and it’ll practically pay for itself!
original_zh_text: 上等货色！毫无疑问，它准能打开某个特殊地方的通路。我敢打赌，那地方肯定堆满了好东西。找到对应的锁，这钥匙就物超所值啦！
translated_text: This is a good key. We can take you to a special place. This place is full of good things. Once you find the castle, in fact, it's available and you can use it!
secondary_translated_text: 这是一把好钥匙。我们可以带您去一个特殊的地方。这个地方到处都是好东西。事实上，一旦你找到了城堡，它就可用了，你就可以使用它了！

original_en_text: <hpage>Caretaker, I bring supplies from the town of bells below the Citadel.<page>And badly needed they are, miss bellringer. Ain’t much finding or foraging happening with this mob, what with them choir types all stalkin’ about the chambers beside.
original_zh_text: <hpage>看守者先生，我从圣堡下方的钟心镇带了补给。<page>啊！真是雪中送炭！圣咏团在附近晃悠，这帮怂包根本不敢出去觅食。
translated_text: <hpage>Belle Butler's castle brought goods from the village.<page>Mr. Bellinger's crowd needed it badly, but his choir floated in the next room and they were all in one place.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>贝尔·巴特勒的城堡从村里运来货物。<page>贝林格先生的听众非常需要它，但他的唱诗班在隔壁房间漂浮，他们都在一个地方。

original_en_text: Buried in the warren of bells, at Pharloom’s core, seek my sullen uncle. That one has power to spare.
original_zh_text: 去纺络的核心地带，在到处是钟的地方找我那阴沉的叔叔，他的力量多得没处使。
translated_text: You have extra strength when you discover a dark uncle buried in the middle of a farm.
secondary_translated_text: 当你发现一个黑暗的叔叔埋在农场中间时，你有额外的力量。

original_en_text: So you found this place too, sister? This Citadel’s grand promise has been strangled away by cursed thread, but at least the great bell here grants us some sanctuary.<page>We’re amongst the blessed few... granted just a little more living.
original_zh_text: 小姐，你也找到这个地方了啊？我们可真是走运。圣堡曾经的宏伟都因丝咒化为了泡影，但多亏了那座大钟，我们才能安全地待在这儿。<page>也许只是片刻安宁，但能多活一会儿……但在这病怏怏的鬼地方，多活片刻就是最好的福报了。
translated_text: "Have you found this place, friend? "The magnificent view of the castle is full of curse, but at least the huge clock here provides us with a refuge.<page>We are a minority and a small part of our lives.
secondary_translated_text: “你找到这个地方了吗，朋友？“城堡的壮丽景色充满了诅咒，但至少这里的巨大时钟为我们提供了庇护所。<page>我们是少数，是我们生活的一小部分。

original_en_text: Off you go now, dear one. If it’s my trinkets you covet, you can trade me your rosaries up at the shrine. Blessings and farewell!
original_zh_text: 你该走了，亲爱的。如果你想要我的这些宝贝，就来钟殿用念珠跟我换！愿你蒙福，再见！
translated_text: If you want my child, please take your rosary beads to the sanctuary.
secondary_translated_text: 如果你想要我的孩子，请把你的念珠带到圣所。

original_en_text: Ooohh... If we’re no longer pilgrims... What are we?
original_zh_text: 噢……我们如果不再是朝圣者了……那会成为什么呢？
translated_text: If we are not pilgrims, what are we? "
secondary_translated_text: 如果我们不是朝圣者，我们是什么？"

original_en_text: Crafty types used to go all a’clamour for this metal. S’not much to look at, but I still remember its value.
original_zh_text: 当年被工匠们抢破头的金属材料。看着不起眼，但老婆子我记得它可金贵着呢。
translated_text: People respect metal very much. They can't see anything but remember its value.
secondary_translated_text: 人们非常尊重金属。他们看不到任何东西，但记住它的价值。

translated_text: Hey, I'm here!

original_en_text: This shrine, awakened... it calls out to ‘em, you see. “It’s safe here. Come on over!” ringing in the ears of every lost pilgrim and grubby so-and-so unlucky enough to have made it to this blasted Citadel with their wits intact.<page>Well, what’s done is done, and what’s rung is rung. Just make sure you come back here soon, you lout! I ain’t dealing with all the fresh intake myself!<hpage>If time permits, sir bug, I shall visit again.
original_zh_text: 只要这钟殿醒着，那些迷途的朝圣者和肮脏的食腐者就会收到召唤。<page>就像在那些家伙耳边低语“这里安全，快来！”，然后他们就会屁颠屁颠地涌向这座被诅咒的城堡。<page>事已至此，你最好尽快回来帮忙！我可不想独自应付这些新来的蠢货！<hpage>先生，若有空闲，我会再来。
translated_text: The temple is awake, it is calling you, Milen! The voices of lost pilgrims and polluted poor echoed in his ears, and his wisdom spread throughout the abandoned castle. "<page>"What have you done? Come back, fool. "<hpage>If you have time, Mr. Berg, I will come back.
secondary_translated_text: 寺庙醒了，它正在召唤你，米伦！迷失朝圣者和受污染穷人的声音在他耳边回响，他的智慧传遍了这座废弃的城堡。"<page>“你做了什么？回来吧，傻瓜。"<hpage>伯格先生，如果你有时间，我会回来的。

original_en_text: Guess I shouldn’t be surprised. It’s a fool act to try such a thing... Maybe even to think on it. Your kind ain’t designed to die.
original_zh_text: 果然还是有所顾虑吗？企图弑君本就是蠢行……或许连想都不该想。你们这一族的命数本就不包括死亡。
translated_text: No wonder you think it's stupid to try and that people like you are destined to die.
secondary_translated_text: 难怪你认为尝试是愚蠢的，而且像你这样的人注定会死。

original_en_text: For the last part, I’ll also be needin’ that rune setter you’re carryin’. Clever old Weaver tool, that thing, and the perfect base on which to stretch our power.<page>Once you’ve collected for yourself the other critical parts, I’ll ask you pass it over as well.
original_zh_text: 最后还需要你身上那个陷阱设置器。精巧的织者工具，正好可以用来作为我们陷阱的基底。<page>等你集齐了其他部分，就把这玩意也交给我。
translated_text: In the last part, you must adjust the runes you have. "This is an old and clever fabric tool and the perfect foundation for expanding our power.<page>After collecting the other components that are important to you, I ask you to give them to me.
secondary_translated_text: 在最后一部分，你必须调整你拥有的符文。“这是一种古老而聪明的织物工具，也是扩大我们权力的完美基础。<page>在收集了对您重要的其他组件后，我要求您将它们交给我。

original_en_text: Find the husk of my cousin, claimed by the scorned bugs of the swamps. A careless fool to let himself be taken, and dead they might be, but some glimmer of his soul can still be sensed.
original_zh_text: 找到我表弟的躯壳，它被沼泽中满怀怨愤的虫子占据了。他粗心大意，才会被抓住并害死。但我仍能感受到他灵魂散发的的一丝微光。
translated_text: If you find your cousin's shell, insects in the swamp will pick it up. They are reckless, self-flawed, and may die, but they can still feel the light of their souls.
secondary_translated_text: 如果你找到了你表弟的壳，沼泽里的昆虫就会把它捡起来。他们鲁莽、有自我缺陷，可能会死去，但他们仍然能感受到灵魂的光芒。

original_en_text: <hpage>Sir, I have the items requested. Craft me your trap that we may see these lands free.
original_zh_text: <hpage>先生，所需物品已集齐。请为我制作陷阱，还此地自由。
translated_text: <hpage>I think I need something. Let me be your trap and let this land be free.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>我想我需要一些东西。让我成为你的陷阱，让这片土地自由。

original_en_text: T’was a good deed you did up above, dear one, saving me from them screeching flocks. Not seen the like of it in a long, long time.<page>I’ve returned with all sorts of new goodies, too. Let’s see if anything I’ve scavenged will fit your fancy.
original_zh_text: 亲爱的，多亏你把我从那些可怕的家伙手上救了出来。我好久遭遇过那样的危险了。<page>我还带了各种各样新鲜的好东西回来。来看看我搜罗到的货物有没有合你心意的。
translated_text: You did good there, saving me from weeping sheep. I'm not afraid of you. I haven't seen anything like this in a long time.<page>I brought you a new one to see if it suits your taste.
secondary_translated_text: 你做得很好，把我从哭泣的绵羊手里救了出来。我不怕你。我已经很久没有见过这样的事情了。<page>我给你带了个新的看看合不合你的口味。

original_en_text: Don’t think I ain’t see’in it, bellringer! A whole lotta helpin’ you’ve been up to, both here and down below!<page>S’a strange mantle you’re takin’ for yourself, seeing all them bugs saved and wishes promised.<hpage>You find it strange, sir? I’ve found some solace in the service, and the rewards received have proved a boon on my journey.<page>Aye! But it ain’t your place now, is it? I see well what you are, Weaver’n more! It’s below your station! You ain’t no common sort meant for carin’ on us low folk.<hpage>I could say the same for you, who still chooses to remain cowled. You continue to pose as only a simple pilgrim. Don’t you think it’s past time you ceased the performance?<page>Leave off, Old One! Permit a bug their small disguise! It’s been a pleasant thing to play simple. And I weren’t calling for change, even if you seem insistent on bringing it!<hpage>Change was unavoidable, sir, whether I arrived or not. The monarch stirs. Its threads stretch far. My presence only accelerates the inevitable.<page>So what’re you hopin’ for, eh? Planning to usurp, to perch above us all as queen? Build up our hopes only to string us all in your own beastly web? Such is the way of Weavers and gods both...
original_zh_text: 敲钟者！别当我没看见！你在这里和下层当活菩萨呢！<page>披着救世主的皮，到处行侠仗义，很别扭吧？<hpage>先生觉得我别扭？帮助其他虫子让我获得了某种慰藉。当然，获得的报酬也能助我前行。<page>呵！可这不是你该干的！我看得出来，你有织者血统！屈尊来操心我们这些贱民的死活，太掉价！<hpage>那你扮成普通朝圣者，不也是在演戏？是时候摘掉伪装了吧？<page>该死！就不能让我活个清净吗？安安静静的普通日子不好过吗？非得去寻求变革！<hpage>变革不可避免，无论我来与否。圣堡之主已然有所行动，其丝线已遍及全境。我的到来不过是加速了这过程。<page>所以你到底图什么？想夺权篡位，成为新的女皇？先点燃我们的希望，然后再把我们困入网中？你们织者和神灵都这副德行……
translated_text: I can't believe I saw this, Belinger, if I were here, I would be very helpful.<page>The coat you're wearing is weird, you'll see that all the worms have been rescued, and your wishes will come true.<hpage>Do you think this is rare? In my ministry, I have found comfort, and in my journey, I have been rewarded by the gospel.<page>Oh, yes! Oh, yes! But it's different now, isn't it? That's not how it works, is it? "Will, you know who you are. I am not an ordinary person who criticizes the lower class.<hpage>I could say the same thing, but I was still wearing jeans. "You are a pilgrim. "<page>Go ahead, old man. Disguise as a little insect. Simple games are fun. I'm not looking for change. I insist on this!<hpage>Whether there is change or not, this is inevitable. The king looked very excited.<page>What do you want to do to win the throne? Are we all trapped in the beast's web? God and God did this.
secondary_translated_text: 我不敢相信我看到了这个，贝林格，如果我在这里，我会非常有帮助。<page>你穿的外套很奇怪，你会看到所有的蠕虫都被救出来了，你的愿望就会实现。<hpage>你认为这很罕见吗？在我的事工中，我找到了安慰，在我的旅程中，我得到了福音的回报。<page>哦，是的！哦，是的！但现在不同了，不是吗？事情不是这样运作的，不是吗？“威尔，你知道你是谁。我不是一个批评下层阶级的普通人。<hpage>我也可以这么说，但我仍然穿着牛仔裤。“你是一个朝圣者。"<page>去吧，老头。伪装成一只小昆虫。简单的游戏很有趣。我不寻求改变。我坚持这么做！<hpage>无论是否发生变化，这都是不可避免的。国王看起来很兴奋。<page>你想做什么才能赢得王位？我们都被困在野兽的网中了吗？上帝和上帝做到了这一点。

original_en_text: You keep at all that helpin’, you’re gonna start inspiring it in others! Best you think serious about what effect you might be causin’, bellringer!<page>Too much hope could prove a dangerous thing, ‘specially for all these bugs starved so long of it.
original_zh_text: 敲钟者！你再这么当救世主，其他虫子都要学样了！你最好想清楚这样会引发什么后果！<page>让浑浑噩噩几辈子的虫子看到希望——这是非常危险的！
translated_text: If you continue to help, you will inspire others. Berlin, you better take your influence seriously!<page>Too much hope is dangerous, especially for all insects that crave it.
secondary_translated_text: 如果你继续提供帮助，你就会激励他人。柏林，你最好认真对待你的影响力！<page>太多的希望是危险的，尤其是对于所有渴望希望的昆虫来说。

original_en_text: Now, why don’t you hurry back to the shrine and let them all know what a good job you’ve done?<page>There might be a few more goodies to gather up on my way back, and I don’t need you lingering around in the meantime. Blessings and farewell!
original_zh_text: 现在，快回去替我报平安吧！<page>我这会儿可没法跟你一块回去，路上可能还有好东西等着我捡漏呢。愿你蒙福，再见！
translated_text: Now, why don't they go to the Temple and tell him how well they are doing? "<page>There may be something good on the way home, or you may not need to walk for a while.
secondary_translated_text: 现在，他们为什么不去寺庙告诉他他们做得有多好呢？"<page>回家的路上可能有什么好东西，或者暂时不需要步行。

original_en_text: Simply forged, and simply styled. Designed to open all sorts of different locks, if they be basic enough.
original_zh_text: 锻造工艺粗糙，样式也朴素。但能打开各种不同的锁——只要锁芯别太复杂。
translated_text: It is easy to forge and easy to form. If it is simple enough, its purpose is to open various types of locks.
secondary_translated_text: 它容易锻造，也容易形成。如果足够简单的话，它的目的就是打开各种类型的锁。

original_en_text: Sister, sister! Let me confide in you! As I ascended the Citadel’s chambers to reach this place, I swear I heard the laughter of a child!<page>Wasn’t much more than an echo, and I confess me fear’s been playing awful tricks on me... and yet that voice still keeps ringing in my head.<page>Surely though, no bug so young and lively could survive within those heartless halls?
original_zh_text: 小姐！你且听我说！在圣堡殿堂上来此地的路上，我分明听到了幼虫的嬉笑声！<page>肯定是回声作祟，要么就是我吓出幻觉了……但那笑声一直在我脑子里萦绕。<page>这鬼地方哪可能有活着的幼虫？你说对吧！
translated_text: Sister! "Sister! "I believe you! When I walked into the castle, I swore I heard children laughing.<page>It's just an echo, but I admit that fear plays an important role, but its sound is still in my head.<page>Right, right? How do these young insects survive in harsh environments?
secondary_translated_text: 姐姐！“姐姐！“我相信你！当我走进城堡时，我发誓我听到孩子们在笑。<page>这只是一个回声，但我承认恐惧起着重要的作用，但它的声音仍然在我的脑海里。<page>对吧，对吧？这些小昆虫如何在恶劣的环境中生存？

original_en_text: Sister, you seen ‘em out there? Our new champion, that golden knight stalking the Citadel’s crumbling halls?<page>Tall, righteous bug. Not much for conversing. Still! I’d be long dead if not for their appearance.<page>And I ain’t the only one. Others have spoken of the knight’s timely deeds and rare bravery.<page>We’re desperate for any protection we can get, and that gleaming champion’s been offering their aid almost as much as you yourself.
original_zh_text: 嘿，小姐，瞧见没？那位在圣堡摇摇欲坠的大厅里巡逻的金甲骑士！<page>高大正直，威风凛凛，不太爱说话。不过！要不是他，我早没命了！<page>不光是我！好多朝圣者都说曾被他及时搭救。<page>现在大伙就指望你和那位英雄护着咱了。
translated_text: Sister, do you see this? Our new champion, the Golden Knight, roams among the ruins of the castle?<page>He is tall and doesn't talk much about justice. If it weren't for them, they would have died long ago.<page>Some spoke of the knights 'timely action and extraordinary courage.<page>We urgently need all possible protection, and this glorious champion has given us the same support you have.
secondary_translated_text: 姐姐，你看到了吗？我们的新冠军金骑士在城堡的废墟中漫步？<page>他个子很高，不太谈论正义。如果不是他们，他们早就死了。<page>有人谈到骑士们及时的行动和非凡的勇气。<page>我们迫切需要一切可能的保护，这位光荣的冠军给了我们与你们相同的支持。

original_en_text: If you’re going to keep skulkin’ around here while I work, you may as well buy something. Take a look dear one, don’t be shy!
original_zh_text: 如果你打算在我干活的时候一直偷偷摸摸地在这儿晃悠，那你还不如找我买点东西。来看看吧，亲爱的，别害羞！
translated_text: If you want to hide here while I work, buy you something, honey, look, don't be ashamed! "
secondary_translated_text: 如果我工作时你想躲在这里，就给你买点东西吧，亲爱的，看，别害羞！"

original_en_text: And last, as the base, seek a weapon of Weavers past. Should still be one left, down there in their largest nest, a snare to set a rune’o searing Silk. Our own trap’ll be woven tight about it.
original_zh_text: 最后是陷阱的基底部分，去找到古织者的工具——陷阱设置器，它可以用来设下灼烧灵丝的符文。<page>应该还剩一个，就在织者最大的巢穴里。我们的陷阱将以它为核心进行制作。
translated_text: Finally, as a foundation, we passed on textiles. The rune must have another trap to carry the burning silk to a larger nest. The trap is turning.
secondary_translated_text: 最后，作为基金会，我们放弃了纺织品。符文必须有另一个陷阱，将燃烧的丝绸运送到更大的巢穴。陷阱正在转动。

original_en_text: Admit it! You done it! You shifty li’l bell-runger!<hpage>You have chosen a curious place to rest, sir. Do you perhaps know something of this shrine and its companions in the lands below?<page>Oh, so you ask funny questions as well as cutting bells free, eh? You certainly ain’t a pilgrim, but you’re clearly not of the Choir either. No! I know exactly what you are...<page>A bell-ringing lout! A weirdo! Don’t you realise what you’ve done, waking that shrine back up?<page>That bell has rung out far and wide! The wretched and the lost will have heard its call. They’ll be making their way here now.<page>Well, what’s done is done, and what’s rung is rung. Just make sure you come back here soon, you lout! You can help me deal with all the dirty little pilgrims and desperate scavengers who turn up.
original_zh_text: 承认吧！就是你干的！你这莽撞的敲钟者！<hpage>先生，你选了个有趣的地方歇脚。莫非知晓这处钟殿与下方各处钟殿的关联？<page>哈！又会问怪问题又会乱敲钟，既非朝圣者也不像圣咏团……我算看明白了——<page>你就是个扰我清梦的怪胎！知道唤醒这座钟殿会引来什么吗？<page>迷途的朝圣者和食腐者都会循钟声而来！<page>事已至此，你最好尽快回来帮忙对付那些脏兮兮的家伙！
translated_text: We will admit it! I did it! You are a prophet of the Koran.<hpage>Did you know that this temple and its satellites, they chose a strange place?<page>There are some interesting questions and free calls. You are not a pilgrim, but you are not a choir. No, no, no! No, no! I know who you are, you know.<page>Bell looks like a fool. How strange! "Do you know what I did to rebuild the Temple?”<page>The bell rang in the distance, and the lost and lost people heard his cry.<page>What you did, what you did, now you can go back and help fools, filthy pilgrims and desperate predators.
secondary_translated_text: 我们会承认的！我做到了！你是《古兰经》的先知。<hpage>你知道这座寺庙和它的卫星，他们选择了一个奇怪的地方吗？<page>有一些有趣的问题和免费电话。你不是朝圣者，但你也不是唱诗班。不，不，不！不，不！我知道你是谁，你知道的。<page>贝尔看起来像个傻瓜。多么奇怪啊！“你知道我为重建圣殿做了什么吗？”<page>远处的钟声响起，迷路的人们听到了他的哭声。<page>你所做的，你所做的，现在你可以回去帮助傻瓜、肮脏的朝圣者和绝望的掠食者。

original_en_text: Oi! What’s this? Suddenly havin’ second thoughts? For sure it’s a frightful thing to attempt, but you’ve already put in all the leg work!<page>She up top’ll already be sensin’ your goal, vague-like maybe, but there ain’t no worth to backin’ out now.
original_zh_text: 喂！这就反悔了？虽然这计划确实骇人，但你都已经走到这一步了！<page>顶上那位早就隐隐约约地感应到了你的企图，现在退缩太迟了！
translated_text: Hey, hey, hey. What are you doing? Did you suddenly change your mind? Of course, I am afraid to try, but I will do my best physically!<page>She already feels like you're like Mary there, but now she shouldn't give up.
secondary_translated_text: 嘿嘿。你在干什么？你突然改变主意了？当然，我害怕尝试，但我会尽我最大的努力！<page>她已经觉得你就像玛丽一样，但现在她不应该放弃。

original_en_text: Stretch a spool out nice and long with this fine-wrought tool. The perfect purchase if you’re planning to hoard a lot of Silk for yourself!
original_zh_text: 这件制作精良的工具能拓展你的灵丝轴容量。如果你打算为自己囤积大量灵丝，这件绝对是必买！
translated_text: We will use this great tool to develop movies. If you are thinking of buying large quantities of silk, this is the perfect choice!
secondary_translated_text: 我们将使用这个伟大的工具来开发电影。如果您正在考虑购买大量丝绸，这是完美的选择！

original_en_text: You keep at all that helpin’, you’re gonna start inspiring it in others! Best think serious about what effect you might be causin’, bellringer!<page>Too much hope could prove a dangerous thing, ‘specially for all these bugs starved so long of it.
original_zh_text: 你再这么当救世主，其他虫子都要学样了！最好想清楚这样会引发什么后果！<page>让浑浑噩噩几辈子的虫子看到希望，这是非常危险的！
translated_text: If you continue to help, you will inspire others. Berlin, please consider your influence seriously!<page>Too much hope is dangerous, especially for all insects that crave it.
secondary_translated_text: 如果你继续提供帮助，你就会激励他人。柏林，请认真考虑您的影响！<page>太多的希望是危险的，尤其是对于所有渴望希望的昆虫来说。

original_en_text: Ooohh... What new horror now besets us?<page>Is this fresh punishment for our sins, or yet another test to prove our faith?<hpage>It is neither, good bug. In this disaster you bear no blame.<hpage>Hold close to your companions, and I will work swift to see this madness stilled.
original_zh_text: 噢……现在又是什么新的灾祸降临到我们头上了？<page>这是对我们罪孽的报应，还是又一次考验我们信仰的试炼？<hpage>都不是。在这场灾厄中，你并无任何过错。<hpage>别离开你的同伴，我会尽快让这场狂乱平息下来。
translated_text: What is he afraid of now?<page>Is this a new punishment for our sins? Is this a test of faith?<hpage>They are all good mothers and are irresponsible for this disaster.<hpage>With the addition of partners, we will end this madness as soon as possible.
secondary_translated_text: 他现在害怕什么？<page>这是对我们罪恶的新惩罚吗？这是对信仰的考验吗？<hpage>她们都是好母亲，对这场灾难不负责任。<hpage>随着合作伙伴的加入，我们将尽快结束这场疯狂。

original_en_text: For the base, we’ll be needin’ a weapon of Weavers past. Search down low, aside the paths of bone, inside their largest nest. S’a snare device, one to set a rune’o searing Silk.
original_zh_text: 陷阱的基底部分需要用到一件古织者的工具——可以设下符文的陷阱设置器。往底层搜寻，就在满是骨头的道路旁，织者最大的巢穴里。
translated_text: The largest nests require the weapons of Weber's past, and they look at the path of bones, the trap Rooney used to burn silk.
secondary_translated_text: 最大的巢穴需要韦伯过去的武器，它们着眼于骨头的路径，鲁尼用来燃烧丝绸的陷阱。

original_en_text: I swear I heard it, sister... That laugh! It almost sounded like they were enjoying themself...
original_zh_text: 小姐，我真没幻听……那笑声……听着像是它们在嬉戏玩乐一样……
translated_text: "I hear your smile, lady. It looks like you are having a good time... ...
secondary_translated_text: “我听到你的微笑，女士。看起来你玩得很开心. ...

original_en_text: Hold this while makin’ music and you’ll soon hear its function. Amplifies song, it does! Sends it out full and bright. Ideal if you’re ever planning on performing for a crowd.
original_zh_text: 演奏时握着这件宝贝，你就能很快体会到它的作用。它能放大乐声，让声音饱满又响亮。要是你打算登台表演，这东西再合适不过了
translated_text: When you play music, you can feel the functions of your hands. This song is really nice. It creates a complete and bright sound. If you are preparing a show for an audience, this will be the perfect choice for you.
secondary_translated_text: 当你播放音乐时，你可以感觉到你手的功能。这首歌真的很好听。它会产生完整而明亮的声音。如果您正在为观众准备演出，这将是您的完美选择。

original_en_text: How about we get your loose beads all strung up safe? I’ll pinch a few for their braiding, but that’s surely worth it for the peace of mind.
original_zh_text: 我来帮你把零散的念珠穿起来，做成便携的链子怎么样？收点手工费不过分吧？图个心安嘛！
translated_text: What would happen if all the pearls were collected? I will also bring some T-shirts and some fabric, but they are worth it for safety reasons.
secondary_translated_text: 如果所有珍珠都被收集起来会发生什么？我还会带一些T恤和一些布料，但出于安全原因，它们是值得的。

original_en_text: Ooh, I’m glad I wriggled my way over here! What a bounty’s been laid out by our benefactors, those generous Conductors! Giants amongst bugs they are, all-seeing and kind!<page>It’s beautiful here, and goodies are everywhere. Only enough for one though, deary, so don’t be greedy! You know I got here first. Blessings, and farewell!
original_zh_text: 啊哈！幸亏我一路摸到这儿来了！咱们的恩主——慷慨的指挥家们，可真是留下了丰厚的赏赐啊！他们全视全知，又心地善良！<page>这儿可真美，到处都是好东西。不过嘛，亲爱的，这些东西只够我拿哦，所以别贪心！你该懂得先来后到。愿你蒙福，再见！
translated_text: A great gift donor and generous driver! They're huge insects, they know everything, and they're good.<page>It's so beautiful and there are good things everywhere. It's enough to eat yourself! I was the first to arrive. Congratulations, sir!
secondary_translated_text: 一位伟大的礼物捐赠者和慷慨的司机！它们是巨大的昆虫，它们什么都知道，而且它们很好。<page>太美了，到处都是好东西。够自己吃了！我是第一个到达的。恭喜你，先生！

original_en_text: You stay close, sister. Them halls beside are crawling with haunted husks.<page>Wandering will only bring death, pointed and painful!
original_zh_text: 小姐，你跟紧点。旁边的那些大厅里到处都是被丝咒附身的躯壳。<page>四处乱走只会带来痛苦的死亡。
translated_text: "Be careful, sister. The room next door is full of ghost shells.<page>Pilgrimage brings only death, corruption and suffering!
secondary_translated_text: “小心点，姐姐。隔壁的房间里堆满了鬼壳。<page>朝圣只会带来死亡、腐败和苦难！

original_en_text: Have you done it yet, bellringer? Wriggled deep? Discovered the depths of obsession that brought this place so low?<hpage>If you speak of this Citadel and its Silk, Caretaker, then yes, I now know the start of it. <hpage>In the ward down below, I saw it clear, the hollowed husks, and the many torturous implements... machines to instill a bug with thread, that would see their life extended.<page>Aye! That’s it, in part! But there’s more scale to it than all that. Just think of’em greedily shoving the Silk into their shells, the madness that overcame them, eternal life for mortal bugs! Then think on how long it’s all gone on...<hpage>...The children born of them, and all the pilgrims after... The Silk has seeded deep into this kingdom’s shells, generations deep...<hpage>No wonder Pharloom’s bugs proved such easy prey for that haunted thread. It had only to seek for itself to reach them.<page>Ho ho! Now you’re seein’ it, bellringer! These poor pilgrims, all born bound to the cruel system of our world, now stricken in its new cursed web.<page>You at least are free from it. And free to shake it all up... if’n that’s your choosing.
original_zh_text: 事情办成了吗，敲钟者？找出那些让圣堡堕落的疯狂执念没？<hpage>若是指圣堡的丝咒，是的，我已知晓其根源。<hpage>下层病房里尽是空壳，以及无数刑具般的器械……那些向甲壳灌注丝线延续生命的机器。<page>没错！但远不止如此！想想他们贪婪吞食灵丝的模样，凡虫妄图永生引发的癫狂！再想想这持续了多少世代……<hpage>……他们的子嗣，后来的朝圣者……灵丝早已深植于这个王国的甲壳内，代代相传……<hpage>难怪纺络的虫子会轻易沦为丝咒的猎物，那些邪丝只需稍加引诱就能侵蚀他们。<page>哈！现在你算看透了！这些可怜虫生来就被束缚在这个世界的残酷体制里，如今又陷进新的诅咒之网。<page>至少你是自由的，自由得足以颠覆这一切……若这是你的选择。
translated_text: You already did it, Belinda? Do you have deep fear? Have you ever noticed that the depth of this attachment makes this place so low?<hpage>If you are interested in castles, silk and guards, yes.<hpage>In the room below, we could clearly see the excavated bullets and torture weapons. The machine uses flow to introduce errors, thereby extending its useful life.<page>Oh, yes! Oh, yes! Cut it into pieces! The ladder is bigger than this. Imagine greedily digging out silk from the sink and pulling it out desperately. Think how long it will last.<hpage>... Their children and the pilgrims who followed them. Silk is deeply rooted in the shell of this kingdom and passed down from generation to generation.<hpage>No wonder pharaoh's insects were easily eaten by ghost children. You just need to find yourself to find it.<page>What is this!" You know what, Berlin? "Poor pilgrims, born under our cruel regime, are now captured by this new cursed web, and now they are in the same place.<page>At least you can bring it out. You are free to change anything you want.
secondary_translated_text: 你已经做到了，贝琳达？你有深深的恐惧吗？你有没有注意到，这种依恋的深度使这个地方如此之低？<hpage>如果你对城堡、丝绸和卫兵感兴趣，是的。<hpage>在下面的房间里，我们可以清楚地看到挖掘出来的子弹和酷刑武器。该机器使用流量来引入错误，从而延长其使用寿命。<page>哦，是的！哦，是的！把它切成碎片！梯子比这个大。想象一下，贪婪地从水槽里挖出丝绸并拼命地把它拔出来。想想它会持续多久。<hpage>...他们的孩子和跟随他们的朝圣者。丝绸深深植根于这个王国的外壳中，代代相传。<hpage>难怪法老的昆虫轻易被鬼童吃掉。你只需要找到自己就能找到它。<page>这是什么！“你知道吗，柏林？“出生在我们残酷政权下的可怜的朝圣者现在被这个新的被诅咒的网络俘虏，现在他们在同一个地方。<page>至少你可以把它拿出来。您可以自由地改变任何您想要的东西。

original_en_text: Well, well, if it isn’t my very own shadow, the clever little red-cloak! You still following me around, trying to pinch away some of the goodies I sniff out?<hpage>You mistake my intent, ma’am, somewhat ungenerously. The pilgrims of the settlement below were worried by your long absence. It was on their behalf that I tracked you, again.<page>Is that so? What a worrying bunch of busybodies they are! I’m still able to fend for meself!<page>Hmph... and yet, perhaps ‘tis a warm thing that I remain in their thoughts so. I hadn’t expected that. And I can’t deny that you too have done me a good turn once more.<page>That awful flock almost had me, truth be told, and I still have to wonder at your intentions, dear one... but bless you, all the same!
original_zh_text: 啧啧，这不是小红斗篷嘛！还在惦记着老婆子我找到的的宝贝？<hpage>女士，你误会了。是庇护所的虫子们担心你的安危，我才再次前来找你。<page>是这样吗？瞎操心！老婆子我纵横圣堡的时候他们都还是虫卵呢！<page>不过……被惦记的感觉倒也不坏。这次算我又欠你一份情。<page>说实话，那群可怕的家伙差点就抓住我了，而你……不管怎样，还是要感谢你！
translated_text: Okay, okay, if it weren't for my shadow, red coat! Are you still chasing me, trying to kill a good man who smells like me?<hpage>I know you misunderstood my intentions and you are not generous. Pilgrims from neighboring colonies feared his prolonged absence. "<page>Is that so? This is a group of people who are really involved! You must eat it! "<page>Yes, yes, yes... ... But staying in your mind in this way might be a hot thing for me. Besides, I don't know what I'm doing. It's not gonna happen, I know. "<page>To be honest, this terrible amount almost reaches me, and I still want to know your intentions, love is a blessing!
secondary_translated_text: 好吧，好吧，如果不是我的影子，红外套！你还在追我吗，想杀一个闻起来像我的好人？<hpage>我知道你误解了我的意图，而且你并不慷慨。来自邻近殖民地的朝圣者担心他长期缺席。"<page>是这样吗？这是一群真正参与其中的人！你一定要吃！"<page>是的，是的，是的……...但以这种方式留在你的脑海里对我来说可能是一件很热的事情。此外，我不知道我在做什么。我知道这不会发生。"<page>说实话，这个可怕的金额几乎到了我的头上，我仍然想知道你的意图，爱是一种祝福！

original_en_text: Looking for goodies of your own, dear one? You’d do well to avoid the dark vaults near here. They say the keepers inside were jealous hoarders even before the silken curse came down.<hpage>You have more familiarity with the Citadel than most, madam. How long have you spent here, surviving amongst the haunted corridors?<page>Oh, long enough. S’not such a bad lot, all told. The memories of my pilgrimage have all faded now, but a life spent in the Citadel’s golden halls was all I ever wished for.<page>And lo and behold, my humble wish was granted! Certainly, the place might be a bit past its prime, but it’d be churlish of me to complain now, wouldn’t it?
original_zh_text: 亲爱的，你也在找好东西吗？你最好避开这附近阴暗的书库。据说在丝咒降临之前，里面的管理员就已经是些抠门的守财奴了。<hpage>女士，你比大多数虫都更熟悉圣堡。这被诅咒的地方生存，肯定也不是件易事吧？你在这儿待了多久了？<page>唔，待了有够久了。总的来说，也不算太差。当初朝圣时的记忆如今已经模糊，但在这金色圣堡度过一生，这就是老婆子我的毕生所求。<page>你瞧啊，我这小小的愿望已经实现啦！当然，这地方或许已经过了鼎盛时期，但现在要是我还抱怨，那就太不识好歹了，不是吗？
translated_text: Is what you are looking for good for you? Even before the Silk Curse, the guard inside was a jealous priest.<hpage>You know your last name better than most people. How long have you lived in that haunted house?<page>All her memories of the pilgrimage had disappeared, but she still wanted to live in the golden room of the castle.<page>Sure, this place may be at its peak, but it's unethical to complain now, right? Actually?
secondary_translated_text: 您正在寻找的东西对您有利吗？甚至在丝绸诅咒之前，里面的警卫就是一个嫉妒的牧师。<hpage>你比大多数人更了解自己的姓氏。你在那栋鬼屋里住了多久了？<page>她对朝圣之旅的所有记忆都消失了，但她仍然想住在城堡的金色房间里。<page>当然，这个地方可能正处于鼎盛时期，但现在抱怨是不道德的，对吧？实际上？

original_en_text: Part of an ancient mask, or a fractured shard of someone’s visage? With the full thing, you’d be better able to protect your shell.
original_zh_text: 古老面甲的一部分？还是谁的面部残片？要是能凑齐整套，肯定能更好地保护你的甲壳。
translated_text: You can replenish an old mask or part of someone's face to better protect the skin.
secondary_translated_text: 您可以补充旧面膜或某人面部的一部分，以更好地保护皮肤。

original_en_text: What a calamity has befallen our holy Citadel! I ain’t never seen anything like it in my long life.<page>Times like this, we must be sure to help each other. Dig deep, dear one, I’ll be needing a lot of rosaries to survive what’s comin’!
original_zh_text: 圣堡这次真是大难临头了！老婆子我活了这么久，这阵仗还是头回见！<page>这种时候，我们一定要相互帮助。帮帮忙，亲爱的，为了挺过即将到来的难关，我需要很多念珠！
translated_text: What a terrible disaster has befallen the Holy City! In my life, I have never seen anything like this.<page>In this day and age, we need to help each other. Dear friends, deeply immersed. We have to go through something that requires a lot of sleeves!
secondary_translated_text: 圣城遭遇了多么可怕的灾难啊！在我的一生中，我从未见过这样的事情。<page>在这个时代，我们需要互相帮助。亲爱的朋友们，深深地沉浸在其中。我们必须经历一些需要很多袖子的事情！

original_en_text: All your work, and look! They keep arrivin’. It’s bugs aplenty up here now. Hapless, weak, but alive they are!<hpage>More scared than weak, they seem to me. It is heartening knowing these few have survived safe for your care.<page>That’s your work, bellringer! Not mine. Ringin’ and helpin’! Hope they recognise your efforts, ‘cause I ain’t providing much, and I ain’t one for fighting if that Choir and their pins ever come callin’.
original_zh_text: 全是你折腾的后果！现在这儿挤满虫子了！又蠢又弱，畏畏缩缩地苟活！<hpage>更像是吓坏了，才显得羸弱。还得多亏有你在这儿照顾他们。<page>喂！别跟我扯上关系！这都是你干的好事，敲钟者！我可不会帮忙打架——要是圣咏团找上门，你自己扛！
translated_text: Look at all our work! They will continue to come. There are many bugs now. They are weak, weak, alive.<hpage>Fear is more than just weakness, and I'm glad I took care of you and survived. "<page>"Bell, you are not my assistant. I didn't offer much, so I want to acknowledge your efforts. "
secondary_translated_text: 看看我们所有的工作！他们会继续来。现在有很多bug。他们软弱，软弱，活着。<hpage>恐惧不仅仅是软弱，我很高兴我照顾了你并活了下来。"<page>“贝尔，你不是我的助理。我没有提供太多，所以我想感谢你的努力。"

original_en_text: Stop and share some of your rosaries before you go scurrying off again, dear one. I’m sure to have something that’s to your liking!
original_zh_text: 亲爱的，先别走，用你的念珠跟我做点小生意再离开也不迟呀。我这儿有各式各样的好货，绝对物超所值！
translated_text: Dear friends, before you rush again, please stop and meditate and share.
secondary_translated_text: 亲爱的朋友们，在再次匆忙之前，请停下来冥想并分享。

original_en_text: Half a spider’s spool. You’d just have to find its match. Them ol’ Weavers built some fine things alright. They’re all long dead, but their craftwork still gleams bright.
original_zh_text: 织者的半个灵丝轴，你只需要找到与之匹配的另一半。古织者的手艺真不赖，虫死了这么多年，其造物还锃光瓦亮。
translated_text: A piece of half spider paper. All you need to do is find your game. The "work" is done well. Although he has been dead long ago, his work still shines.
secondary_translated_text: 一张半蜘蛛纸。您需要做的就是找到您的游戏。“工作”做得很好。尽管他早已去世，但他的作品仍然闪闪发光。

original_en_text: A gleaming find for you climbing types. With this in your claw, you’ll be able to stick to walls for as long as you like!
original_zh_text: 对于你们这些攀爬爱好者来说，这可是个不可多得的宝贝。握在爪子里就能无限黏附峭壁——想挂多久挂多久！
translated_text: The beautiful opening is an ideal place for climbing. How long can you stand with your feet against the wall?
secondary_translated_text: 美丽的入口是攀岩的理想场所。你的脚靠在墙上能站多久？

original_en_text: Down in the mosslands, still clinging to her failed chapel, my sister’ll part with her power, if asked kind enough.
original_zh_text: 去苔地找我那守着破教堂的姐姐，态度客气点，她或许会分给你力量。
translated_text: My sister is obsessed with the failure of the church in the muddy fields, and if anyone says I am good, I will relinquish my authority.
secondary_translated_text: 我姐姐痴迷于教堂在泥泞的田野里的失败，如果有人说我很好，我就会放弃我的权威。

original_en_text: <hpage>Grant me your aid, sir. If your trap provides a path to freedom, both for myself and your land’s bugs, I may indeed choose to trigger it.<hpage>What work do you require of me now to see your service made?<page>It’s my family’s strength you’ll need be seeking, bellringer, us three ol’ bugs still alive, spread ‘cross this kingdom, and that sad soul you’re already carryin’ there, the last of my poor cousin, dead and drained in those rotten swamps.<page>Each of my family has power, raw, savage stuff. For you, they’ll give it, if for their fascination at the act, or the thrill of defiance... or because they have no choice at all.
original_zh_text: <hpage>请助我一臂之力，先生。若你的陷阱真能为这片土地的虫子和我带来自由，我愿成为那个安放它的猎手。<hpage>现在需要我做些什么？<page>去召集我家族成员的力量——三个苟活的老家伙，他们分散王国各处。还有一个正是你已找到的这悲惨灵魂的主人，他是我可怜的表弟，死在了腐臭的沼泽。<page>我的家人每个都带着野蛮原始的力量！他们会把力量交给你——或是出于对你这种勇气的欣赏，或是享受反抗带来的的亢奋……抑或是别无选择。
translated_text: <hpage>If your trap gave me and the insects on your land a path to freedom, I would decide to provoke you.<hpage>What do you want to do to verify your service?<page>I must find strength in my family, a bell, three old bugs still alive, and the sad soul you brought, the poor last dead man, who died of dryness and putrefaction.<page>There is something powerful, primitive, barbaric in our family. Because for you, it's because when they come in, when they experience rebellious emotions, either they give you a choice or you don't have a choice.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>如果你的陷阱给了我和你土地上的昆虫一条自由之路，我会决定挑衅你。<hpage>您想做什么来验证您的服务？<page>我必须在我的家人身上找到力量，一只钟，三只还活着的老虫子，还有你带来的悲伤灵魂，可怜的最后一个死去的人，他死于干燥和腐烂。<page>我们的家庭里有一些强大、原始、野蛮的东西。因为对你来说，是因为当他们进来时，当他们经历叛逆情绪时，要么给你选择，要么你别无选择。

original_en_text: <hpage>Sir, I have opened the way above these halls, and bested the white knight that stood as guardian.<hpage>Child of the monarch, she claimed herself at the end, and her shell suggested it true, a being born purely from Silk woven tight. <hpage>That such a feat is possible... I have seen life woven from Silk before, but tiny, transient... Never like this...<page>Aye, bellringer! You’ve slain a marvel indeed... Well, flawed marvel, at least.<page>One to keep far from she was, least for us mortal sorts. Look of a child and a mind to match, but her’s been up wanderin’ this Citadel longer’n most. Even in its long silence, way ‘fore you came and roused its ire. <page>Might’a seen herself this place’s protector, keepin’ it clean and quiet as she did. Course quiet meant most crossin’ her path found a painful end from her pin.<page>I’d be sayin’ thanks for the slaying, but with all the other husks now awoken and enraged, a bug’s chances ain’t grown by much.
original_zh_text: <hpage>先生，我已打通上层通路，击败了守卫的白骑士。<hpage>她自称君主子嗣，其甲壳构造显示此言非虚——纯粹由致密灵丝编织。<hpage>如此造物真是超乎寻常……灵丝编织的生命我倒也见过，但都渺小且残缺。和她相比，简直天差地别……<page>哈！敲钟者，看来你宰了个神迹一般的家伙……好吧，至少是个有瑕疵的神迹。<page>一直以来，对于我们来说，都是离她远点为妙。她长得孩童模样，心智也相仿，却已徘徊在圣堡多年——早在你到来并激怒她之前。<page>她自诩圣堡守护者，清扫所有“不洁者”。凡是靠近的都成了其针下亡魂。<page>本该谢谢你除掉她，但现在其他空壳都被唤醒并激怒了……咱们的处境可没变好。
translated_text: <hpage>I broke the hole and defeated the white knight.<hpage>After all, she claims to be the daughter of a monarch, and her shell proves it, she is a natural creature that weaves finely silk.<hpage>I have seen life intertwined with silk, but it has never been so short and short.<page>Mr. Bellinger, he killed the miracle. At the very least, this is an imperfect miracle.<page>At least for us humans, we are still far away. She looks like a little girl, I agree, but she has been walking around this castle for a long time. Even in this long silence, before you provoke.<page>He may consider himself the keeper of the place, in order to keep it clean and quiet, but the silence of the process means that most of the people he meets have a tragic ending.<page>I wanted to thank him for killing him, but the chances of the insect being present were low because all the other shells were awake and angry.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>我打破了这个洞，击败了白衣骑士。<hpage>毕竟，她自称是君主的女儿，她的贝壳证明了这一点，她是一种编织细丝绸的自然生物。<hpage>我见过生命与丝绸交织在一起，但它从未如此短暂和短暂。<page>贝林格先生他扼杀了奇迹至少，这是一个不完美的奇迹。<page>至少对于我们人类来说，我们还很遥远。我同意，她看起来像个小女孩，但她已经在这座城堡里走了很长时间了。即使在这漫长的沉默中，在你挑衅之前。<page>他可能认为自己是这个地方的守护者，以保持它的干净和安静，但这个过程的沉默意味着他遇到的大多数人都有一个悲惨的结局。<page>我想感谢他杀了他，但昆虫存在的可能性很低，因为所有其他贝壳都醒着，愤怒着。

original_en_text: Hello again, dear one. Looks like we both made it up here, safe as told. And what a shock to find you were speaking the truth about this place!<page>A settlement like this in the Citadel, nice and safe, cloistering so many bugs with minds intact! Never seen anything like it, nor even imagined such.<page>Makes trading away all of my nice bits and baubles much easier. After all, I want to take lots and lots of rosaries with me when my strength finally fails!
original_zh_text: 又见面啦，亲爱的。看来咱俩都如预想的那样平安到达这儿了。真没想到你说的这个地方居然是真的！<page>在这圣堡里有这么一处庇护所，既舒适又安全，还住着这么多心智健全的虫子！我从没见过这样的地方，连想都没想过会有。<page>在这儿做点小买卖可容易多啦！毕竟，等我老得不行的时候，我想带上好多好多念珠，风光下葬呢！
translated_text: Goodbye, darling. We reconciled, we're safe. "I'm surprised what you said about this place is true.<page>The castle is good, safe, and away from insects. With such facilities, the heart remains unchanged! I've never seen anything like it before, I can't imagine it.<page>All my beautiful gadgets make trading easy. When my strength runs out, I will use a lot of Roger!
secondary_translated_text: 再见亲爱的我们和解了，我们很安全。“我很惊讶你所说的关于这个地方的话是真的。<page>城堡很好、安全，而且远离昆虫。有了这样的设施，心不变！我以前从未见过这样的事情，我无法想象。<page>我所有漂亮的小工具都让交易变得容易。当我的力量耗尽时，我会大量使用罗杰！
